channel.title: Blogs on Jeff Sandquist
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Jeff Sandquist

item.title: Church in Benson, Saskatchewan
item.description: I take many photographs each week. A church in the small Canadian village of Benson, Saskatchewan. My parents were married in this church.

item.title: Dusk Is Nearing On A Dock At Lake Kachess
item.description: A dock at my friend John Reeve‚Äôs cabin at Lake Kachess.

item.title: P51 Mustang‚Äôs Flying In Formation Above Payne Field
item.description: 3 P-51 Mustang‚Äôs that I captured at a recent event with the Flying Heritage Collection at Payne Field.

item.title: How To Make A Big Decision
item.description: Last summer our oldest daughter was married and I had the awesome responsibility of saying a few words at the wedding reception to the newly married bride and groom. I do a fair amount of speaking in my job as an Evangelist at Microsoft, but this was a very different talk. After a lot of thought (over months) on what to talk about, I came to the decision that I should relay one of the better pieces of advice that I have received.

item.title: Hummingbird In The Snow
item.description: It snowed again this morning at our home in Fall City, Washington. I‚Äôm not sure when this cruel joke of winter will be over here. I moved away from Saskatchewan to leave snow. Although to keep it in perspective, it hasn‚Äôt really been cold. üôÇ Making up for it all was this amazing photo that my wife captured this morning. Great show¬†of a hummingbird braving the winter for a drink in our backyard.

item.title: Diners Drive-Ins and Dives in Las Vegas
item.description: I‚Äôm a major fan of the television program Diners Drive-Ins and Dives. This show with Guy Fieri goes across the United States popping into great places with good food. Here in Seattle I‚Äôve eaten a few times at Voula‚Äôs Offshore Cafe which has been on the show. You have to eat their Greek Hobo. I‚Äôm actually on a secret mission (guess its not a secret now) to eat at all of the places that Guy Fieri frequents on his popular Food Network show.

item.title: Streaming Live With Scott Guthrie, Jeff Atwood and Twitter
item.description:
Once again for Mix, my team worked on what we call the live experience. Since PDC 2003, we‚Äôve been working on ways for the folks at home and those attending in person can make a connection to the event.
With¬†this work we‚Äôve streamed the keynotes live, published breakout sessions for on demand viewing, filmed behind the scenes videos for Channel 9 along with some humorous ones and even overlaid Tweets tagged #MIX09 on top of the live keynote player on the web site and on the big screens in the keynote halll via our Flotzam screen saver.

item.title: My Daughter Was Banned From Club Penguin
item.description:
My 9 year old daughter is a major fan of Disney‚Äôs Club Penguin. She loves to go online in this virtual world, hanging out with her friends, updating her status and buying virtual items to trick out her igloo.
Photo Credit: Chaos1017 Josie was sad this week when she attempted to login to Club Penguin and was denied access. ‚ÄúA moderator has banned your account for 24 hours‚Äù

item.title: Selectively Synchronizing Facebook and Twitter Status
item.description: One of my more popular blog posts is where I explain how to push your Facebook status to Twitter. When I wrote this, about two years ago, people were more likely to update their Facebook status than Twitter. My hack with TwitterFeed made it simple to push that status update to Twitter. Times have changed since then and I find myself updating my status to Twitter and wanting to be selective about what I update Facebook with my Twitter status.

item.title: Supporting Web Standards With Microsoft
item.description: Today, my team has released Oxite.¬†Oxite is an open source, standards compliant, and highly extensible content management platform that can run anything from blogs to big web sites. We are releasing this as our second edition of the Mix Online web magazine that focusses on web standards.¬†Oxite¬†began as a side project of Adam Kinney and Duncan Mackenzie and is a subset of the Channel 9¬†source code. When it was time to do a reboot of the Mix Online¬†web site¬†Duncan and his team created an experience where could release the source code (a popular customer request of Channel 9) that used ASP.

item.title: Watching Microsoft PDC From Home
item.description: I promised that I would be back. I am. It has been a very exciting time with Microsoft PDC week now here. One of the things that is new from my team is the PDC live event coverage. On the homepage of the PDC Website, you are able to watch the day 1 and 2 keynotes live. We‚Äôve also superimposed recent activity from Twitter alongside the keynote stream. This is one of my favorite parts of the experience.

item.title: Bill Gates Transitions To The Foundation
item.description: This morning we posted a very special interview on Channel 9¬†with Bill Gates.¬†In this video interview, Charles Torre sits down with Bill Gates and they talk about everything from philantropy, the CSA role, competition with Google and platforms. I believe this will go down as one of our greatest Channel 9 interviews of all time and with a little over 1600 videos¬†produced to date, that is saying something.

item.title: The 4th Version of Channel 9 Is Now Live
item.description: Today we completed the deployment of Channel 9 Version 4.0. We‚Äôre still doing some final stabilization work that includes tweaking performance, but we‚Äôre on our way. This is a 100 per cent rewrite of the predecessor and has been a long time in the making. A little over five years ago Channel 9 came on the air, some would say ushering in a wave of transparency for Microsoft and becoming a poster child for corporate blogging.

item.title: This Blog Is Now Running Graffiti by Telligent
item.description: For the past five and a half years, I‚Äôve been running DasBlog. It has served me well over the years and I‚Äôm really appreciative of Chris Anderson for giving it a start with BlogX and finally to Clemens, Omar and Scott for moving it along as DasBlog. For quite some time¬†I have wanted to make a move to something that had more extensibility, better themes and more of a self service admin.

item.title: Perspectives with Jon Udell
item.description: Jon Udell joined our team this past year.¬†In a short period of time he has played a huge role in help shape the content and approaches we take in creating content for the Evangelism Network. (Better know as the network of communities including Channels 8, 9, 10, Mix Online and TechNet Edge. Today Jon is launching a new Microsoft-oriented interview series called Perspectives. The show covers a variety of topics including robotics, digital identity, e-science, and social software.

item.title: Hard Rock Cafe Memorabilia
item.description: Demo of the year for music fans. Not just a demo, going live this week.Hard Rock Cafe

item.title: MIX08 on Channels 9, 10 and Mix Online
item.description: So we‚Äôre down here at Mix¬†and what has now become a tradition my team is providing real-time coverage of the event via Channels 9, 10 and Mix Online. We‚Äôll have something for everyone.¬†All the cool demos and deep dives with the partners along with the keynote stream are on Mix Online. On Channel 9, for the hardcore Developers we‚Äôll have deep dives with the folks who build the product.

item.title: Channels 8 and 9 on Microsoft.com
Students Get Microsoft Software For Free!
item.description: Ok, this will hopefully go down as one of those announcements as, ‚ÄúMan, it is about time someone did this!‚Äù.¬†Tonight, over on Channel 8 Bill Gates is announcing Microsoft DreamSpark. With DreamSpark on Channel 8 students can download Visual Studio , Expression and Windows Server. These aren‚Äôt limited editions or time bombed copies either, its the full meal deal. Today, DreamSpark we are going live in 10 countries, including Belgium, China, Finland, France, Germany, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, the U.

item.title: Last Chance to Join Our Team
item.description: We‚Äôve had a number of new faces join the team in last few months. Max Zuckerman joined us to as Student Content Machine on Channel 8, Dan Fernandez is cranking with Channel 9 and Nic Fillingham is relocating from Singapore to work on Channel 10. Guess what?¬†We have room for one more.¬†Over on Duncan‚Äôs team we have an opening.¬†Come join the Microsoft team that works hard, plays hard and is changing how Microsoft connects with the community through social media.

item.title: Where the heck have I been?
item.description: Man, what a wild ride the last couple of months have been.¬†As usual we‚Äôre going full tilt, building out the code that drives the Evangelism Network and the content that keeps people coming back for more. üôÇ¬†It has been a while since I‚Äôve blogged about what‚Äôs going on in my life and there has been plenty going on at work and at home.¬†I figured I‚Äôd update you all about work, my life at home is pretty well documented thanks to Flickr and Facebook.

item.title: Dan Fernandez Joins Channel 9
item.description: We found our Yogi Bear. Dan Fernandez has joined our team and will be a new addition to the Channel 9 team, a new partner in crime for Commander Torre.¬†I‚Äôve known Dan for sometime and have always enjoyed working with him.¬†One of the first things we did together was a Summer of Express contest on Channel 9 back in 2004. Dan‚Äôs definitely familiar with what we do (he was the 41st person to register on Channel 9), but will bring plenty of new ideas to the team.

item.title: Sammamish Plateau Mountain Bike Skills Park
item.description: An article in today‚Äôs Seattle Times, caught both both the eye of myself and my neighbor: After years of pushing for a mountain-bike ‚Äúskills park‚Äù on the Sammamish Plateau, the Backcountry Bicycle Trails Club got a $150,000 boost from King County to move forward with its plans, county officials announced Wednesday. The club signed an agreement to work with the county on developing the 120-acre project at Duthie Hill Park, a swath of second-growth conifers and deciduous trees that is underused, county officials say.

item.title: Charles Fitzgerald's Last Day
item.description: Today was Charles Fitzgerald‚Äôs last day at Microsoft. He will be missed and it is a sad day for many of us at the company, to see him move on. I will miss his brutal honesty, book recommendations and never-ending support for the community work my team does with Channels 8,9, 10 and Edge. An anonymous commenter over on Mini, nailed it when they wrote the following about Charles: If you ever sat in any of his presentations at places like the Platform Strategy Review events, and talked with our top customers, he ‚Äògot‚Äô them and they ‚Äògot‚Äô him.

item.title: Channel 10 ‚Äì The Bill Gates on CES 2008 Interview
item.description: Our first of many interviews of CES [now live on Channel 10][1] or here on my blog, thanks to Silverlight. Speaking of Silverlight, I am really looking forward to what the [NBC Olympics coverage][2] will be like with Silverlight.  Awesome news.

item.title: Channel 10 CES Coverage Begins
item.description: We‚Äôre here at the Podtech Bloghaus watching the Bill Gates CES keynote unfold.¬†It is the best seat in the house for CES. üôÇ I am here with my Channel 10 team who are covering the event for Microsoft.¬†We‚Äôve just¬†published¬†an interview from this morning with Bill Gates¬†and will have an a great video with Robbie Bach up momentarily. We‚Äôll have plenty of content going live all through the week both about Microsoft and many other cool geeky things from across the industry.

item.title: The Spammers tried to take over my Wikis
item.description: A couple of years back I created a set of Wikis.¬†The first was to help folks track resources for David Allen‚Äôs Getting Things Done Methodology.¬†The second was to help people find power outlets in airports. Over the years both of these sites have flourished in popularity.¬†The AirPower wiki in particular has been written up in a variety of travel magazines and the Getting Things Done Tools list sees very regular updates.

item.title: Architectural Renderings of The High Streets
item.description: The High Streets is a new shopping center under construction a few miles south of our home.¬†It will be located in the Issaquah Highlands and is scheduled for completion in the Fall of 2009.¬†Once completed it will include a variety of retailers, an upscale grocer, restaurants, a hotel, health club, and a theater. We‚Äôre looking forward to it and won‚Äôt miss the trek from Fall City to Redmond.

item.title: Webkinz Overloaded
item.description: Merry Christmas everyone. I can imagine Webkinz broke all sorts of sales records for itself, today.¬†As I was saying back in October:Mark my words, Webkinz will be one of the top toys this holiday seasons for kids ages 6 ‚Äì 13+. The site has been overloaded today, making it difficult and sometimes impossible login at times due to a large volume of traffic. Here‚Äôs a screenshot from the login page.

item.title: Headed to CES?
item.description: Let us know on the CES Wiki.¬†See you in Vegas.

item.title: Internet Explorer Passes Acid 2
item.description: Yes Virgina there is a Santa Claus. Internet Explorer 8 will/passes that Acid 2 Test.¬†Charles interviews the team on Channel 9 and more over on the Internet Explorer Team Blog. ¬†

item.title: Cool Wall With Adam Kinney
item.description: Check out the [Christmas CoolWall][1] on Channel 10

item.title: Marc Orchant
item.description: Today in Marc‚Äôs passing my thoughts, prayers and a heavy heart go out to his family and close friends.¬†I had the pleasure of meeting Marc Orchant a number of years back.¬†We both shared a passion for Getting Things Done.¬†Marc was an awesome writer and left behind a great online history through Download Squad, OfficeZealot and more recently Blognation.¬†In moments like this I am often short on the right words to express grief and will turn to music.

item.title: Saskatchewan Roughriders Win the Grey Cup
item.description: Saskatchewan defeated Winnipeg 23-19 in the 95th Grey Cup.  It is a great day to be from Saskatchewan.¬†I can already hear my American friends say, ‚ÄúHow cute! Canadian football‚Äù. üôÇ Photo Credit: CBC Sports

item.title: Grey Cup Weekend In Seattle?
item.description: Anyone checking out the game on Sunday?

item.title: Saskatchewan Roughriders Arrive Home
item.description: Awesome.

item.title: Welcome to TechNet Edge
item.description: Welcome to TechNet Edge Just doing a quick test of embedding TechNet Edge videos in my blog via Silverlight.¬†TechNet Edge is a new community for IT Pros and a sister site to Channels 8, 9, 10 and Mix Online. We‚Äôre still in the process of taking this site live and won‚Äôt be open officially for business until Monday morning. You can go over now and play as we stabilize though.

item.title: Testing Our Updated Media Player
item.description: Registration for Mix‚Äô08 is now live.¬†My team has been working literally around the clock moving Mix Online to the EvNet 4.0 Codebase.¬†I‚Äôve talked about EvNet 4.0 previously, in a nutshell this is a common set of code drives Channels 8,9, 10 , Mix Online and something new we‚Äôre calling¬†TechNet Edge.¬†EvNet 4.0 is lean, localizable and for the future.¬†This post is mostly about testing our new ‚Äúsharable‚Äù Silverlight player than anything else.

item.title: Scene It for the XBox 360 arrives this Tuesday
item.description: Scene It for the XBox 360 is coming out on Tuesday.¬†(11/06/07).¬†This will be the first game that my wife will purchase for our console and actually play. üôÇ¬†At $60, it is a pretty good deal as you get both the trivia game and 4 custom controllers.¬†

item.title: Show Us Your Home ‚Äì Episode 1
item.description: The first episode of our Channel 10 series called ‚ÄúShow us your home‚Äù is now online.¬†I talked about this a little while back here. The goal of this series is take folks into the homes of a wide variety of geeks, both inside and outside of our company.¬†The high order bit of course is not the home itself, but the use of technology.¬†Think about it, Channel 9 brought you inside the halls of Microsoft, now Channel 10 will take you to their homes.

item.title: Twitter Error Messages
item.description:
I love it when software developers allow their sense of humor to bubble up.¬†The Twitter folks do a good job of this in their error messages.
I do like the error messages my team is now now surfacing up for file not founds. üòâ¬†I wonder what else we could do.¬†It is a subtle thing to remind folks that there are actual human beings writing software, not machines.

item.title: Windows Live Photo Gallery Now Supports Flickr
item.description:
Lots of news today going around the blogs about the addition of Flickr publishing to to the Windows Live Photo Gallery Beta.¬†Check out LiveSide, I Started Something, The Microsoft PhotoBlog and¬†Windows Live Wire for their perspectives. I installed it this morning while riding in on the bus (got to love bus service with wireless Internet).¬†After installing, this dialog box absolutely made my morning.
Why? I‚Äôve been a Flickr user for a long time.

item.title: Follow Microsoft Channels 8,9,10 and Mix Online with Twitter
item.description: You can now receive notifications of new content on Channels 8, 9, 10 and Mix Online through Twitter.¬†I just put the finishing touches on this little side project over lunch today.¬†(Note to self, don‚Äôt order the cajun lunch special again. :-)) Want to get started?¬†Are you a Student? Follow Channel 8 Are you a Developer or Architect? Follow Channel 9 Are you a Power User? Follow Channel 10

item.title: Microsoft Employees Show Us Your Home!
item.description: Are you a power user?¬†(wow, that‚Äôs an out of date Wikipedia page if I‚Äôve ever seen one :-)) Anyhow, if you are a power user, please read on. A couple of nights ago Larry Larsen, Max Zuckerman and I got together to film some new content at my home for Channel 10.¬†This will used for a new series where we go to the homes of fellow Microsoft employees and show the technology they use.

item.title: Microsoft Employees Show Us Your Home!
item.description: Are you a power user?¬†(wow, that‚Äôs an out of date Wikipedia page if I‚Äôve ever seen one :-)) Anyhow, if you are a power user, please read on. A couple of nights ago Larry Larsen, Max Zuckerman and I got together to film some new content at my home for Channel 10.¬†This will used for a new series where we go to the homes of fellow Microsoft employees and show the technology they use.

item.title: Is Webkinz the next Facebook?
item.description: I‚Äôve seen the question of, ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the next network to go big after Facebook?‚Äù¬†Webkinz of course.¬†Mark my words, Webkinz will be one of the top toys this holiday seasons for kids ages 6 ‚Äì 13+. A real conversation from last night at dinner between our daughters Josie (8 years old) and Brynn (21 years old).¬†Brynn of course is part of the Facebook generation¬†(more here).¬†Josie is part of an equal phenomena known as Webkinz World.

item.title: Jeff Sandquist on Channel 9
item.description: Yes me. üôÇ¬†I‚Äôve been in a few team interviews with my team who create Channel 9, but for whatever reason I‚Äôve never had the camera turned around on me. I prefer to be the ‚Äúbehind the scenes guy‚Äù managing the chaos. Last week though, Rory grabbed a camera and interviewed me for Channel 9.¬† View this video over on Channel 9 <center> &nbsp; </center> This is one of the final interviews Rory did at Microsoft.

item.title: Looking for Yogi Bear
item.description: I‚Äôm hiring¬†and with that I‚Äôm spreading the word about the open¬†positions I have to a lot of folks.¬†Today while describing the jobs, I got to talking about Robert Scoble.¬†I often get asked about what Robert did best for Channel 9. There were a lot of things Robert did great for Microsoft especially outside of Channel 9 and I could go on for awhile for those things.

item.title: Really Achieving Your Childhood Dreams
item.description: If you watch one piece of media this year, please make it this one.¬†It is about 90 minutes in length and is absolutely riveting.¬†I‚Äôm actually listening to it again this morning as I work through email. Carnegie Mellon Professor Randy Pausch, who is dying from pancreatic cancer, gave his last lecture at the university Sept. 18, 2007, before ‚Ä¶ all ¬ª a packed McConomy Auditorium. In his moving talk, ‚ÄúReally Achieving Your Childhood Dreams,‚Äù Pausch talked about his lessons learned and gave advice to students on how to achieve their own career and personal goals.

item.title: Come Work At Microsoft In Evangelism!
item.description: There‚Äôs only one team for me at Microsoft and that of course is Developer & Platform Evangelism.¬†It is called DPE inside Microsoft.¬†Within DPE lives my group that creates both technology and the content that drives Channels 8, 9 and 10.¬†As a team we‚Äôre on a mission to change how Microsoft does Evangelism and that is through the combination of social media and online community.¬†We have a bunch of openings on our team.

item.title: Channel 9 Version 4.0 ‚Äî Believe
item.description: View this video over on Channel 9 The video shown above in many ways accurately describes how my team has felt over the past year.  We signed up for a big mission, to go beyond just Channel 9 and deliver a network of online community focused on a wide variety of audiences.  It has been hard.   Sometimes we wondered if we’d win the war.  Today a small, but important victory.

item.title: Channel 9 Gets Silverlight
item.description: Yes Ryan Stewart, Adobe Evangelist üôÇ we‚Äôve fulfilled your dreams, Channel 9 now uses Silverlight for its media experience. üòâ Ryan Stewart writes: Also, when is Channel 9 going to support Silverlight so I don‚Äôt have to load up Qucktime to watch it? See this video on Channel 9! Happy to have you as a faithful Channel 9 viewer, especially with all the Silverlight content as of late.

item.title: The Return From My Sabbatical
item.description: I‚Äôve been back on the job for a little over three weeks, returning from my sabbatical from Microsoft.¬†A lot of folks ask me what it is like to be back and wonder how it is going though.¬†So I thought I‚Äôd write a few paragraphs here to explain. In many ways my return to my team reminds of a lot of a speeding locomotive.¬†The locomotive is speeding down the tracks at over 100 miles per hour and I needed to get on.

item.title: The High Streets Mall
item.description: As mentioned previously in a post, there‚Äôs a new shopping center going in a few miles south of us.¬†My neighbor Nancy, left a comment in my previous with a link to the website for the development.¬†The shopping center is being called The High Streets.¬†The developer is Real Retail and they‚Äôve behind some nice projects in the Puget Sound like Pacific Place, Kent Station¬†and University Village.

item.title: Office Makeover
item.description: I arrived at work today and found my office received a bit of a makeover. More photos . Photo credit: Volker Will

item.title: Issaquah Highlands Mall
item.description: It appears that we are getting a new mall, about four miles directly south from us on the Issaquah Highlands.¬†The Issaquah Highlands Undressed and Issaquah Undressed blogs are reporting that¬†construction has begun on a new mall for the area. I haven‚Äôt been able to find many details online, but the undressed sites say that the mall will rival Bellevue Square¬†/ Redmond Town Center in size.¬†If you have more information on the project, please drop me a line via the comments on the blog so I can keep this post up to date with the latest news.

item.title: Returning to Microsoft from Sabbatical
item.description: It seems just like yesterday that I was headed off on my sabbatical from Microsoft.¬†This has been a break chalked full of memories that I will have for a lifetime.¬†As I prepare for the burn of reentry, I thought it would be useful to pen some random thoughts about my break.¬†There have been so many highlights.¬†The massive road trip that Josie and I took, making peace with my past, getting involved with the Skate Like A Girl non-profit, laser eye surgery spending time with my wonderful wife Lauri¬†,¬†hanging with our cool dog Brady¬†and getting to know my neighbors.

item.title: Childhood Ingenuity Bubblewrap
item.description: Kids are smart. Check out a fun little game that Josie and her neighborhood friends came up with today.¬†Living in a new neighborhood means lots of people unpacking.¬†With unpacking you have a lot of bubble wrap on hand. For great fun, all you need is a Razor Scooter, a fresh roll of bubble wrap and your friends. Video: Bubbles Popping Razor Scooters Aren‚Äôt kids great? Do try this at home.

item.title: The Family Home on Holmgren Bay is sold
item.description: The place that I grew up at on Holmgren Bay in Estevan, Saskatchewan has now been sold.¬†Estevan, an area rich is natural resources, is booming right now.¬†There is a lack of housing now so the sale was very quick. Mom and Dad will be moving out to condo life on the west coat of Canada taking new roots in Kelowna, B.C.¬†For Mom and Dad this will mean a warmer climate, the end of yard maintenance and a much shorter trip to visit us down in Fall City, Washington.

item.title: Teamwork with Skateboarding
item.description: This photo will go down as one of my favorites from an amazing summer break.¬†Josie and I went out yesterday with a bunch of folks from Skate Like A Girl to the Skatebarn in Renton.¬†Skatebarn is an amazing facility with over 45,000 square feet of ramping goodness.¬†Extra bonus is that on Wednesdays its free for girls. The half pipe was to tall for Josie to get to the top.

item.title: How to publish your Facebook status to Twitter
item.description: With the addition of public facing feeds to Facebook I am now able to publish my status on Facebook to Twitter.¬†Here‚Äôs how you can do it also. First, find your status RSS feed on Facebook.¬†It is buried.¬†(Thanks Bizzle!¬†for helping me find mine.)¬†To find it, you need to visit your profile on Facebook and on your mini-feed select “See All”.¬†On the right you will see a list of items, select ‚Äústatus stories‚Äù and finally below this a feed link can be found.

item.title: Amazon to open grocery service? Amazon Fresh
item.description: Is Amazon opening up a grocery service?¬†I spotted this interesting truck today in Bellevue, Washington.¬† I sure hope they are opening a grocery service.¬†Our family loved the now defunct HomeGrocer.com service from the late 90s.¬†We were “beta testers” and used it as our only grocery service for quite some time. The services Safeway and Albertsons have opened just don‚Äôt compare to what was Home Grocer. Anyone have a link to Amazon Fresh or a beta invite?

item.title: Flickr Wallpaper Rotator
item.description: Check out Rush Frisby‚Äôs¬†Flickr Wallpaper Rotator application, written using¬†.NET Framework 2.0 This tray application cycles through your desktop background to a photo from Flickr.¬†You can specify tags, user names with how often you want the background image to change. I have mine set to feature pictures from the Flickr colorful tag every couple of hours. Cool. Edited: Updated ro fix broken link (01/02/08)

item.title: Life is good
item.description: I am feeling great, rested and healthy.¬†Although I am still recovering from the Custom PRK Laser Eye surgery, every day my vision is improving.¬†In the mornings I can see well enough to use a computer, but by evening that is an impossibility. I hope you are having a great summer too.

item.title: Microsoft On Facebook: 17,802 Strong
item.description: Over on WinBeta they are writing: Microsoft has a giant presence on Facebook, with over 17,000 employees (out of 70,000 worldwide) joining their Facebook network. Since you need a Microsoft email address to get it, it‚Äôs highly unlikely these are anything but real Microsofties, and the large number means Facebook is becoming a pretty important means of communication inside MS. You‚Äôll be able to find the real profile of Bill Gates in there, and discover that he has only 57 friends, while Ray Ozzie has 105 friends, including Mike Arrington, Steve Ballmer, Don Box, Joanne Bradford, Steve Case, Steve Chen, Anil Dash, Gary Flake, Steven Levy of Newsweek, Dare Obasanjo, Jeff Sandquist, Robert Scoble, and Mark Zuckerberg.

item.title: Skate Like a Girl Camp in Kirkland, WA
item.description:
Skate Like a Girl will be partnering with Kirkland Teen Union Building for the second summer to present two week long skateboard camps for girls.¬†One for older teens will be held July 30 through¬†August 3, 10am ‚Äì 4pm).¬†Then August 6-10 a camp for younger girls will take place. Sign up your daughters now!
In order to register you must first create an account with the City of Kirkland, and then you can register for the camps.

item.title: Every Car You Chase ‚Äì The Police mashed with Snow Patrol
item.description: I been listening to a lot of music over the break.¬†80s Canadian Rock, New Country,¬†Beatles and The Police.¬†An accidental discover though was a mash up between The Police and Snow Patrol.¬†Check out Every Car You Chase¬†by Party Ben.¬†Really cool. listen

item.title: Skateboarders are Athletes
item.description: Imagine if we treated all athletes like we do skateboarders‚Ä¶.. Photo taken outside of Washington Mutual in Sammamish, WA

item.title: Saying Goodbye to George Symons
item.description: An old family friend, George Symons has passed away.¬†In many ways Geroge was like a grand father and his entire family was a big part of my family. Many folks back in Estevan believe I am related to the Symons Family.¬†We‚Äôre not, at least not by blood.¬†In fact some of the best family are the ones you choose. I got to¬†know George and family when¬†my mother went to work for them running their grocery wholesale business back in the 80‚Äôs.

item.title: Recovering from PRK Laser Eye Surgery
item.description: I haven‚Äôt updated this blog with my recovery progress since having PRK. PRK is a laser eye procedure different than Lasik.¬†PRK¬†has a much longer recovery time.¬†The goal of both Lasik and PRK is the same, which is to enable people to see without glasses.¬†I had wavefront guided custom PRK. For the first few days with PRK there was a great deal of discomfort and it has taken about a week to regain semi-functional vision without the use of eyeglasses.

item.title: PRK Laser Eye Surgery Today
item.description: Today is the day for my PRK Laser Eye Surgery. From reading the forums on USA Eyes, it sounds like I am not going to want to be on the computer for a number of days due to vision fuzziness.¬†I also won‚Äôt have the ability to drive for a number of days. I‚Äôve loaded up an MP3 player with audio books and music to help pass the time. I‚Äôll post updates on how the surgery has gone as my new vision allows.

item.title: 7-11 Kwik-E-Mart: Cool Cross Product Promotion
item.description: Last night, in Seattle I was able to see one of the coolest cross product promotions ever.¬†In order to promote The Simpsons Movie, 20th Century Fox has partnered with 7-11 to make over select 7-11 Stores as Kwik-E-Marts.¬†Kwik-E-Mart, of course is the local convenience store from The Simpsons television series. Stores in twelve cities in Canada and the United States have received the make over.¬†In addition to changing the signage they have launched new products too.

item.title: Surgery on Thursday
item.description: Lasik surgery that is. For over 25 years I‚Äôve worn glasses.¬†Without my glasses I am useless.¬†I‚Äôve tried contact lenses but have had problems with getting them in my eyes. Thursday though, hopefully will be the end of my relationship with eyeglasses.¬†I am going in for Lasik surgery.¬†Technically it is not Lasik that I am getting.¬†Due to some anomalies with my eyes I will need to have PRK (Photorefractive Keratectomy) instead.

item.title: New Header Graphics
item.description: Michael Giles created a few new headers for my blog to honor my vacation.¬†I added a random image¬†script to my Dasblog installation to cycle through them, showing a new one each time a page is refreshed. You can see them all in the Flickr set.¬†These definitely are capturing the essence of my vacation so far. üôÇ¬†My favorite is the hammock shot.¬†I plan to add more to the pool as time goes on.

item.title: Dasblog 1.97
item.description: Just updated to Dasblog 1.97 this morning.¬†A few new features, but I can‚Äôt find the documentation on how to enable older posts pagination. Anyone? _Postscript:¬†Scott answered me in my comments. üôÇ _Will do the trick! _

item.title: Striped Hammock from World Market
item.description: Might pick it up tomorrow. üôÇ _Postscript: Got it!

item.title: Happy 4th of July!
item.description: Photo Credit: Kevin Crafts

item.title: Josie's Gift
item.description: Josie has been asking to cut her hair for a while now ‚Äì finally Lauri relented after one too many tangles and a few too many arguments. We‚Äôve heard of Locks of Love and we were explaining to Josie how long its taken to grow her hair from super-short to just at her bum (2 solid years) and she really didn‚Äôt care. Ah well, it‚Äôs just hair, right? üôÇ So, with one cut, Josie lost nearly 12 inches of hair and then Lauri spent another 15 minutes evening it all up and she has a cute new summer ‚Äòdo.

item.title: Happy Canada Day!
item.description: Happy Canada Day!¬†Photo Credit: Tim Van Horn

item.title: Josie and I are Home from our trip
item.description: After a little over 2900 miles, 3 provinces, four states and after two weeks on the road Josie and I are back home from our trip.¬†Plenty of photos can be found on Flickr.¬†It was an awesome adventure.¬†Thank you Janice, Yarek, Lynda and Mom and Dad for the places to stay.¬†To all the old friends. thanks for giving Josie and I so much to do.¬†We‚Äôll be talking about this trip for years.

item.title: Canadian Crop Circle Research Museum
item.description: Yes you can in Estevan. üôÇ¬†Estevan is now home to the Canadian Crop Circle Research Museum.

item.title: Wired Fiction is D√©j√† vu
item.description: Another article up from Fred on Wired.com.¬†Seems¬†the opening of the article is a little bit of fiction to tee up some drama.¬†From, ‚ÄúTechCrunch Blogger Michael Arrington Can Generate Buzz ‚Ä¶ and Cash‚Äù ‚ÄúMichael Arrington was sound asleep in his bedroom in Atherton, California, when three men burst in. Naturally, he was startled. His first reaction, he recalls, was to tell them to ‚Äúget the fuck out.‚Äù But he quickly realized they meant no harm.

item.title: Goodbye to Sam The Record Man
item.description: I was about to write a post about re-discovering my album and cd collection in my parent‚Äôs basement and I just heard that Sam the Record Man will be closing the doors to its famous Yonge¬†Street location in Toronto, Ontario. It wasn‚Äôt long ago that Sam The Record Man was Canada‚Äôs largest music retailer with 130 stores Canada wide.¬†Now only three locations will remain. Sam The Record Man was the store where I purchased my very first album, Kiss Alive II.

item.title: Flight over Southern Saskatchewan
item.description: It continues to be quite a busy and fun trip up to in Estevan, Saskatchewan.¬†On Monday my Dad, my Uncle Dale and I chartered a small plane to take a tour over the local area. Things sure look different from above.¬†We saw the¬†Alameda Reservoir/Dam, the Shand Power Generation Plant, Estevan Comprehensive High School¬†and a number of other places. My favorite view of all was Benson, Saskatchewan.¬†This is the small town of about one hundred people where I grew up.

item.title: I'm getting a lot of sun :-)
Estevan, Hot Spot in Canada
item.description: The last few days, Estevan (where Josie and I are currently staying) has been the hot spot temperature wise for all of Canada.¬†The temperatures have been around 32.2 degrees Celsius. Kevin Armstrong and I took our girls out on Boundary Reservoir for a day of boating.¬†Kevin recently purchased an eighteen foot¬†Sea Ray¬†and we had a great afternoon out on it.¬†We went cruising, tubing and swimming.¬†The water in Boundary Reservoir is nice and warm.

item.title: The Tower Cafe has the best pizza on the Planet
item.description: I had the best pizza on the planet today at the Tower Cafe¬†in Estevan, Saskatchewan.¬†I think I eat two of these pizzas (not in the same evening) whenever I come and visit.¬†Today¬†it was at lunch with two old friends, Kevin Toombs and Kim Empey.¬†Our pizza was the Tower Special which has mushrooms, pepperonis, ham, green peppers, and pineapple on it.¬†The sauce is a little spicy and there is plenty of cheese.

item.title: Nothing Compares to a Saskatchewan Sunset
item.description:
You can‚Äôt beat Saskatchewan sunsets!
I took this last night as we were coming in from an evening of fishing on Rafferty Dam.¬†Really nice evening, 90+ degrees outside and the water was smooth as glass. More photos [over on my Flickr site][3].  It has been a lot of fun hanging out with old friends here in Estevan.  I think we’ll stay for awhile.

item.title: Canadian / American Tour Update
item.description: Josie and I have been on the road since Sunday morning for our big trip.¬†We decided to delay our departure by a day so we could pack, get the windshield repaired on my car and make sure we‚Äôre rested up. It has been a wonderful trip.¬†We have put on almost 1300 miles so far and have put a few photos up on our Flickr set in the process of getting here.

item.title: and so it begins..
item.description: Time to decompress, pack and begin the trip.¬†More interesting stuff (to some :-)) soon.¬†

item.title: Humming Bird In Our Backyard
item.description: Friday morning, around 7 am, Lauri noticed a little hummingbird in our backyard, trying to get something out of the globe lights around our umbrella. Interesting. Around 7 am this morning, the hummingbird was back, only this time it was sticking its long beak into the orange bell shaped blossoms on our Thompson Maple tree that we had planted when my folks were in town. She had looked up online what to put in the feeders, and boiled some water, let it cool down and added the sugar.

item.title: Five Years of change at Microsoft
item.description: Think you can predict the future of tech? üôÇ¬†Check out this post by Jon Udell from almost 5 years ago: Duncan Wilcox ruminates on how blogs can help implement the communication strategies outlined in the Cluetrain manifesto: Of course it‚Äôs not as if starting a weblog automatically opens a corporation up to conversations, but it‚Äôs a good start. For example reading Ray Ozzie‚Äôs weblog has made me very interested in Groove (the product) and generally makes me feel good about Groove (the company) ÔøΩ in long term that would make me trust both.

item.title: Summer Vacation ‚Äì a "do over"
item.description: This year I‚Äôll celebrate eleven years at Microsoft. In September of 1996 I maxed out a credit card to relocate from Estevan, Saskatchewan to Redmond, Washington joining up with Microsoft as a contractor.¬†As a contractor I didn‚Äôt qualify for relocation benefits, but I figured it was a worthy risk :-).¬†My first job¬†was to support the beta of Active Server Pages¬†along with¬†Internet Studio.¬†Later on I made the transition to full-time employee status, supporting the released editions of these new Internet products.

item.title: Inch by inch to Channel 9 Version 4.0
item.description: Robert Scoble in a post about Zoomr¬†made a reference to my motto of inch by inch.¬†This phrase has been a part of my vocabulary¬†since the summer¬†of 2002, after seeing a Microsoft internal parody¬†video of Al Pacino‚Äôs speech from Any Given Sunday.¬†When success with a certain problem/project seems insurmountable it makes sense to retreat to a shorter term goal.¬†Once you make that goal, move onto the next and eventually you will make that touchdown.

item.title: My Day As a Race Driver
item.description: As mentioned previously, my wife gave me a day of Performance Driving Training as an early birthday gift.¬†On Tuesday this week I spent the day at Pacific Raceways road course in a class led by Don Kitch.¬†The driving would be done my in my own car, a Corvette. The day began at 8:00 am sharp (after signing off on a lengthy liability waiver) with an in class presentation by Don.

item.title: Proformance Training
item.description: It will be an extended long weekend for me.¬†My Mom and Dad came into town and on Tuesday, I‚Äôll be having my birthday present¬†down at Pacific Raceway. It has been a great weekend with the folks.¬†You see my Dad has had quite the battle with Cancer and is recharging from several recent surgeries.¬†You know how they say, ‚ÄúWhen it rains, it pours ?‚Äù¬†In our family it has been a¬†total moonsoon on the family health front.

item.title: Hiding our hot tub
item.description: We have a hot tub that I use very regularly.¬†I have rheumatoid arthritis and the hot tub really helps me sleep at night.¬†It is definitely a keeper. üôÇ To be honest though I don‚Äôt like the look of it on our patio.¬†My wife and I have begun to think through the plans for our new backyard and have been trying to decide what to do with the hot tub.

item.title: ScrewTurn Wiki Version 2.06
item.description: I‚Äôve been looking for some wiki code for a side project.¬†I had looked at MediaWiki (didn‚Äôt really want to do PHP) and was happy to find ScrewTurn Wiki¬†today. Interesting, definitely looks a lot more feature rich than Flexwiki.

item.title: Channels 9 + 10 at the CEO Summit
item.description: I watched the CEO Summit live on the web this year.¬†It is cool that they streamed Bill‚Äôs keynote and you can watch it now on demand.¬†My favorite part was the following section¬†about 10 minutes in:The last thing here I wanted to mention is that with video arriving on the Internet, it‚Äôs possible for a company to create essentially their own TV channel. And it‚Äôs actually better than a TV channel in that people can come in and watch at any time video on demand.

item.title: Gallery Player for Comcast
item.description: I‚Äôve played with Gallery Player a bit in the past via a Media Center PC.¬†Amazing photographs, stunning visuals and lots of variety in content.¬†I didn‚Äôt keep using the product though and had forgotten about the company. While browsing Comcast HD on demand the other day I found a Gallery Player option.¬†Turns out Gallery Player is now available via Comcast on Demand.¬†The collections are in high defintion, have music in the background and are really cool to put up while not watching TV.

item.title: Flickr Screensaver 4.1
item.description: Been meaning to post this for awhile.¬†Sam Judson has updated his Flickr Screensaver for Windows. I set mine to show everyone‚Äôs photos and adjust the tag regularly, today it is set to the colorful tag¬†an old faithful. Photo credit: Kohlieo ¬†

item.title: Microsoft Popfly
item.description: In the spring of 2003 Microsoft opened its kimono with Channel 9 and today we‚Äôre popping our fly. üôÇ¬†Sorry, couldn‚Äôt resist, cool name though.¬†I‚Äôve been a fanboy of Project Springfield since I heard about it late last summer.¬†In a nutshell Popfly is an easy way to build mashups, gadgets, Web pages, and applications.¬†Rory interviewed the team behind the project earlier this week and posted a video to Channel 9 a few moments ago with the team¬†and John Montgomery piles on with The Genesis of Popfly¬†and why he thinks it is cool¬†over on his blog.

item.title: Google vs. Meetup
item.description: Clever.¬†(Hat tip: Valley Wag)

item.title: J. Allard Loses A Bet
item.description: Very cool that J. Allard kept up his end of the bargain when he lost a bet with N‚ÄôGai Croal from Newsweek.¬†If the PSP outpaced the¬†sales rate of the PS2 in the United States J. would dawn N‚ÄôGai‚Äôs hairstyle (dreadlocks) and if it didn‚Äôt N‚ÄôGai would get a buzz¬†cut. J. lost. J‚Äôs bio page has been temporarily replaced on the Microsoft.com bio page¬†to include his updated photo.

item.title: Flickrvision is cool
item.description: David Troy is at it again with Flickrvision.¬†Flickrvision is a mashup of Google maps and Flickr photos.¬†I find this a bit more interesting than Twittervision¬†since it is obviously a bit more visual. ¬†

item.title: Look Out Weekend Here I Come
item.description: Look out weekend, here I come.¬†üôÇ¬†The past couple of weeks have been crazy with Mix and a bunch of other stuff. I was unsucessful in my attempt to unplug last weekend.¬†Let‚Äôs see if I can succeed this weekend. Lots of non-Internet stuff going on, see you all on Monday. ¬†

item.title: Silverlight 1.1 Alpha Samples
item.description: Just walked by the Channel 9/10 Team lounge, Karsten was sitting on the couch and¬†asked, “Have you seen Lutz Roeder‚Äôs awesome Silverlight samples?"¬†I hadn‚Äôt and Karsten gave me a demo. These are awesome.¬†My favorite sample is Monotone, check out the music is in perfect timing withe visuals.¬†Lutz has also created a cool Boulderdash clone and an in-page MP3 player.¬†Full source is available from the samples page.

item.title: Scoble Raving About The Microsoft Phone System
item.description: The Microsoft automated phone system actually does work [as well as Scoble says][1]: Microsoft has a really cool voice-controlled system. You dial the number, an electronic voice answers and asks you for the person‚Äôs name you‚Äôre trying to reach. You SAY it. ‚ÄúJeff Sandquist‚Äù and then it comes back with a recording of Jeff Sandquist so you know you‚Äôre going to the right place. ‚ÄúAre you looking for ‚ÄòJeff Sandquist, Channel 9‚Ä≤‚Äù?

item.title: The Official Ramen Homepage
item.description: I still eat Ramen Noodles.¬†It drives my wife crazy and I can probably do without all the sodium, but they are so quick and easy.¬†Perfect ‚Äúguy snack food‚Äù.¬†I boil them, drain most of the water and add the flavour package as seasoning.¬†When I want to go ‚Äúupscale‚Äù I visit¬†the official ramen noodle blog and grab a recipe.¬†There is also a book I‚Äôve been meaning to add to our cook book collection, 101 Ways to Eat Ramen Noodles.

item.title: Greed 2.0
item.description: One of my favorite movies in the 80s was Wall Street.¬†In fact one of my best friends Kevin Armstrong and I, with great pride would recite the famous, ‚ÄúGreed is Good Speech‚Äù on demand.¬†We were in high school and it was a fun parlor trick for social studies class.¬†Kevin learnt it from watching the movie on VHS over and over.¬†I was a closet geek and used Cinemania on my multimedia PC.

item.title: Beijing Olypmics and Silverlight
item.description: Joshua just posted a fun video over on the Mix site with Rory interviewing the Beijing Olympic Technical Team.¬†Great moments in this interview include getting mascots through immigration, godzilla impersonations and their use of Silverlight for the Beijing Games. üôÇ On a much more technical note Laurence Moroney has a great blog post where he explains the two¬†installation modes for Silverlight ‚Äì direct and indirect. Check out the Beijing Mascots!

item.title: Publishing Lots of Video Content at an Event with Mix
item.description: One of the more insane things that my team has done lately (we have a list and we track these things you know üòõ ) was the content production we did for Mix.¬†While at Mix we conducted about fifty interviews with Microsoft partners, event attendees and product team folks.¬†For the first two and half days of the event Rory was doing non-stop interviews, Laura coordinated all the edits, Joshua drove the publishing process and Sampy ensured all was well on the homefront.

item.title: Trench Doc shows Transparency in Medicine
item.description: People definitely have gotten a better idea of what the folks behind software at Microsoft are like with our bloggers and Channels 9 + 10.¬†Transparency has helped change how many perceive our company and at the very least has made the last 3 years of my life a lot more interesting. üôÇ Awhile back when looking for bloggers outside of the tech business I came across Trench Doc.¬†Trench Doc is written by a Doctor who works the emergency room at a ‚ÄúSouthern Regional Medical Mecca‚Äù.

item.title: Greensburg, Kansas Photos
item.description: Total destruction.¬†Very Sad.¬†Donations can be made online at the Red Cross Website.

item.title: FeedBurner Move Complete
item.description: It worked. üôÇ The move to FeedBurner should be complete.¬†Note to folks who plan on doing¬†this with Dasblog.¬†The configuration page in Dasblog asks for your FeedBurner username.¬†It doesn‚Äôt really want that. My username for FeedBurner is JeffSand, but my feed is http://feeds.feedburner.com/jeffsandquist, so on the configuration page for DasBlog I had to specify JeffSandquist, not JeffSand. I think if you make this mistake you potentially could lose subscribers if their aggregator gets an incorrect 302 message from DasBlog.

item.title: Moving my Blog Feed to Feedburner
item.description: I‚Äôm moving the RSS feed for this blog to Feedburner.¬†Omar and Scott¬†¬†made the switch quite some time ago and from reading their blogs they are happy with it.¬†For most of you, no action should be required as Dasblog 1.9 will automatically redirect your RSS Aggregator to my new feed. I like the idea of off-loading bandwith and the improved statistics that come with Feedburner.¬†There are¬†some risks in outsourcing syndication.

item.title: Saturday Night Burgers and Fries
item.description: I love to cook.¬†There is nothing more relaxing and stress relieving for me than finding a recipe, following the steps, maybe improvising a bit and tasting the final results. üôÇ¬†Over the years we‚Äôve assembled quite a cookbook collection in our home.¬†Some of my favorites are from way back in the past.¬†What‚Äôs cool about the older cookbooks that we have is that they are handwritten.¬†Many were created for family reunions, anniversaries and homecomings with family members submitting their recipes.

item.title: T-Mobile Dash Windows Mobile 6.0 Upgrade Now Available
item.description: I just completed the upgrade of my T-Mobile Dash to Windows Mobile 6.0.¬†You can grab the upgrade yourself from the T-Mobile site.¬†Chris Ziegler at Engadget has a great overview¬†of what you can expect from the upgrade. Prior to completing the update make sure you grab data off of your device (like photos or music).¬†The update will perform a hard reset on your device erasing all of your stuff.

item.title: Early Birthday Gift ‚Äì Performance Racing School
item.description: While I was down in Vegas with Mix, my wife sent me a message telling me that she had purchased my birthday present.¬†My birthday is a little over a month away so she was going to have some fun teasing me.¬†I‚Äôm really good at guessing these things, so ever since I‚Äôve return from Vegas I have been playing 20 questions with her.¬†I didn‚Äôt come close to guessing.

item.title: Cutline Theme for Dasblog
item.description: I‚Äôm playing around with CSS today and the Dasblog theming engine using Expression Web.¬†I‚Äôve updated my blog‚Äôs layout and theme using a variation of the famous WordPress Cutline Theme.¬†This theme is popular and is used by many¬†Wordpress bloggers like¬†Matthew Ingram.¬†With a little bit of hacking, I got it functional on Dasblog. Still some tweaks left¬†to do (need to reenable search, cleanup the comments form) but that is going to have to wait.

item.title: Upgrading to Dasblog 1.9
item.description: Getting caught up on some things this morning, like upgrading my blogging engine to 1.9.6264.0 of Dasblog which was released back in September.¬†Postscript: Upgrade complete.¬†Now tinkering with my themes.

item.title: Elvis covers Mix for VisitMix.com
item.description: [Check it out][1].  You can thank [Charles Fitzgerald][2] for the lyrics. üôÇ  We also have some earlier coverage of Elvis [here][3].

item.title: Silverlight brings Channel 9 to the homepage of MSDN
item.description: One of the cool things shipped today was how the MSDN team is now using Silverlight on their homepage.¬†This is great, but what‚Äôs even cooler is that its showing Channel 9 videos. The MSDN team wrote this cool little player on top of a set of RSS based services that Duncan on my team wrote a little while back.  Thanks MSDN guys for doing this!

item.title: My Favorite Keynote Quote from the Audience in Twitter
item.description: Jason Mauer on Twitter...ScottGu debugging a .NET app running in Safari on the Mac‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs the sound of thousands of people simultaneously crapping their pants Charles Torre, just posted a great interview with Scott on Channel 9 that really digs into the details on Silverlight.

item.title: Mix is Live and Worldwide
item.description: We‚Äôre live and worldwide with VisitMix.com.¬†The keynote is streaming now¬†and we‚Äôll start bringing partner demos online later this morning along with a number of Channel 9 videos too.¬†Tomorrow afternoon we‚Äôll also begin posting all the materials and videos from the sessions as well. Between the blogs, the main feed on the mix site and our session videos its like having a conference outside the conference. Talk to you soon.

item.title: Blogger Meetup + BlogZone Warmup
item.description: ![][1] ![][2] ![][3] A couple of quick notes for today. Dave is putting together a blogger dinner for tonight. I‚Äôve updated my Mix BlogZone posts to clarify its location and added some photos. Things are coming along great at the event, I‚Äôm updating my my Flickr feed with photos from around the conference today. Going to be some fun times ahead.

item.title: Stress Relief Art ‚Äì Steps 6,7 and 8 ‚Äì Job Complete!
item.description: Continued from before‚Ä¶.Step 6: The border is complete, it was a lot harder to get the alternating colours looking like we wanted them to, they look ok but honestly we are worried once we apply the object lines they will look too busy. Step 7: Bribe the handyman from our builder with a Thomas Kemper Soda variety pack (he doesn‚Äôt drink wine or beer) to create a frame with left over millwork.

item.title: Heading Off to Vegas
item.description: Everyone is getting ready to head off to Las Vegas for Mix¬†and some folks from our team are already there.¬†You can feel the energy building up through the blogs and¬†inside the halls of Microsoft as we near day one of Mix.¬†I came to work at Microsoft because of the World Wide Live events¬†and have been a part of building these things at our company all the way back to the Denver PDC.

item.title: The Channel 9 Choir
item.description: Crank your speakers and [tune into the Channel 9 Choir][1].  Thanks Jamie and congratulations on your launch of [Pikspot][2]. ¬†

item.title: The Mix Wiki
item.description: Dave Winer has started a Mix Wiki.¬†Fill it out.

item.title: Keep Moving Forward Part 2
item.description: Not only does the movie rock, so does the soundtrack.¬†Little Wonders by Rob Thomas is a song I seem to have stuck on repeat mode lately.¬†(wonder why that is? :-))¬†Just keeps me moving forward. It is all hands on deck right now as our group gets Mix ready to roll.¬†It is times like this, when I see everyone pulling together for a common cause that I know I‚Äôm at the right company.

item.title: You Voted, We Listened
item.description: Fred‚Äôs definitely making inroads into the blog conversation lately. üôÇ¬†Lots more talk today about radical transparency.¬†On a related note the results are in and so is Fred.¬†We‚Äôre going to find a way to get him into the building.¬†Some thought he should dress up as Elvis and others felt he should be a special Channel 9 correspondent to attend.¬†Fred, we can iron out those details at the event‚Ä¶

item.title: Fred Vogelstein ‚Äì An Exercise In Radical Transparency
item.description: [][1] [Should Fred go to Mix?][1] If you remember a little while back my team and I were part of an experiment in radical transparency¬†with Wired Magazine.¬†Today begins part two of that same experiment.¬†It turns out that Fred Vogelstein was slow in registering for the Mix Event that we‚Äôre holding in Las Vegas next week, we‚Äôre sold out and last weekend he asked if we could find a spot for him.

item.title: Pirates at the Libraries and Grease Monkey Scripts in Internet Explorer
item.description: A recently new introduction in our family has been the public library.¬†Josie is reading now at almost a 3rd grade level now.¬†(Very proud Dad here, she‚Äôs in the first grade :-)) and so she‚Äôs always looking for new books.¬†Each Sunday we try and make it out to our local library to get some new reading material.¬†Josie thinks this is quite a trick, a conversation she and I had a couple of weeks back‚Ä¶

item.title: The Mix BlogZone
item.description: During Mix my team will be filming a variety of content to cover the event.  If you’re following along at home you’ll be able to watch this all on the [Mix Community site][1]. We’ll have interviews with partners who are building cool stuff, product team interviews/demos and conversations with attendees.  It can be challenging to get decent bandwith to upload content like this while at an even so we’ll be using the Mix BlogZone as our HQ.

item.title: Dog is my copilot
item.description: I believe this qualifies me to ride in the HOV Lanes, right?

item.title: Stress Relief Art ‚Äì Step 5
Channel 10 Brings You Geeks on Peaks
item.description: [][1] Now, here‚Äôs a project that has been amazing to see come together.¬†We call it ‚ÄúGeeks on Peaks‚Äù.¬†Channel 10, in conjunction with Summits of Canada, is sponsoring an expedition to summit Mount Logan in early May. During the month-long trek, James Coleridge will document, blog, shoot pictures, and do video interviews from the second highest peak in North America. You will be follow along from the comfort of your home via Channel 10.

item.title: Lou Carbone on Creating Customer Loyalty
item.description: I‚Äôm listening to more and more podcasts on my drive into work in the morning and the main feed from Gigavox‚Äôs IT Conversations Network rarely dissapoints.¬†This morning I¬†really enjoyed a talk Lou Carbone gave on Creating Customer Loyalty. Lou Carbone, author and CEO of Experience Engineering, Inc. will change the way you think about customer experience forever. His message to business leaders and professionals is simple: Create customers that come back and customers that tell others, by connecting emotionally with them through the experiences you deliver.

item.title: Stress Relief Art ‚Äì Step 4
item.description: Continued from before‚Ä¶. Ok, we took a brief interlude.¬†Josie couldn‚Äôt wait to use it so we seasoned the chalkboard after the final coat of paint had dried.¬†To season we took a piece of chalk and slid it end to end on the wall using the side of the chalk.¬†We completely covered the wall in chalk.¬†Once that was done we took a damp piece of cloth and wiped all the chalk off.

item.title: Keep Moving Forward
item.description: I‚Äôm with Marc, Disney is back with¬†one of the best movies I‚Äôve taken in this year,¬†Meet The Robinsons.Lauri, Josie and I went on Saturday and just loved it.¬†My favorite part of the movie though was not the animation, soundtrack or storyline.¬†It was the final quote by Walt Disney in the closing credits that tied the whole thing together. ‚ÄúAround here, however, we don‚Äôt look backwards for very long.

item.title: Casa Batllo ‚Äì wow
item.description: Jason is in Barcelona and was able to tour Casa Batllo.¬†wow, add that to the list of 1000 things to see before you die.

item.title: Stress Relief Art ‚Äì Step 3
item.description: Continued from [before][1]….. Remove the border tape (you’ve got to love those crisp clean edges) and get ready to tape over for the border to be painted in.

item.title: Stress Relief Art ‚Äì Step 2
item.description: Continued from before‚Ä¶ Step 2: Ok, so we applied two coats of the magnetic paint and we sanded it lightly so it the surface was consistant.¬†One it was dry we masked off the outside edges further and applied two coats of black chalkboard paint.It is now drying and we‚Äôre almost ready to ‚Äúdraw in‚Äù the border.

item.title: Stress Relief Art ‚Äì Step 1
item.description: Step 1: Square off an area of the wall and open a can of magnetic paint¬†and apply two coats.¬†(Wait 24 hours between each coat)

item.title: More on Wired
item.description: Yesterday was an interesting day to say the least with the storm of activity around the Wired Article.¬†Folks saw first hand a briefing document that was leaked accidentally by a Microsoft employee and had a view inside the relationship between public relations and a magazine reporter.¬†I wanted to highlight some of my favorite commentary from the blogs around the story to give some further insight and perspective. Charles Fitzgerald ‚Äì What transpired with Wired

item.title: Wired Magazine Article on Channel 9
item.description: It was last fall that Chris Anderson¬†invited me over to Wired Magazine for lunch ‚ÄúCond√© Nast Style‚Äù (they have a private chef) and it was all pretty cool.¬†Chris gave me a personal tour of the facilities and told me all sorts of stories behind the history of Wired Magazine.¬†I would be lying if I didn‚Äôt say that this was a bit of a thrill for me.¬†In the tour I saw where Apache Server was coded, a wall crowned with every cover of the magazine and a view of their future through the new www.

item.title: My Dad is fine
item.description: Quick update: Dad got a bed after waiting in emergency for about 24 hours and is now recovering.¬†He did ultimately lose the bed about 24 hours after his surgery was finished, mom drove him back to Estevan and he was admitted into the local hospital.¬†He‚Äôs resting and doing fine. ¬†¬†

item.title: Health Care in Canada Versus United States
item.description: I am originally from Canada spending most of my youth in Saskatchewan.¬†Saskatchewan was one of the first places in the world to create socialized medicine through a system known as medicare.¬†This was later adopted by the entire country.¬†I grew up with¬†socialized medicine as the norm and now live in a country without.¬†It is with great interest that I watch the candidates line up for the next presidential election discussing the possibilities of free health care for all.

item.title: In The New Place
item.description: It will be a light posting on my blog this week as I‚Äôm taking the week off to get settled in our new home.¬†There is a much longer post coming up soon on what I did learn through this around contingencies, selling your home in general and what a difference a great real estate agent can make.¬†This is definitely an industry that needs technology.¬†The whole process quite complicated and delivered stress at a level I‚Äôve never encountered¬†before.

item.title: Michael Garternberg Joins Microsoft
item.description: Just a quick note this morning to confirm that Michael Gartenberg [is joining Microsoft as an Enthusiast Evangelist][1]. After working as an industry analyst for more than decade, I‚Äôm leaving JupiterResearch to join Microsoft as an enthusiast evangelist. What is an enthusiast evangelist? Our job is to find, engage and work with enthusiasts and other influencers and show them all the cool stuff that Microsoft is doing. In short, it‚Äôs our job to act as the bridge between Microsoft and end users.

item.title: Pandora Tray Application
item.description: Not sure how I missed this cool Pandora Tray Application.¬†I love Pandora¬†for listening to music, but don‚Äôt like that I have to keep a browser window open to run it .¬†This application allows me to tune into my Pandora channels, rate songs and most importantly minimize the action to my system tray.¬†(Hat tip: Adam Kinney) technorati tags: pandora

item.title: Grand Canyon Skywalk
item.description: The closest I‚Äôve been to the Grand Canyon is flying over it in a Red Bull Stunt plane with Flight Simulator X.¬†Looks like they are adding a skywalk.¬†Looks cool, would love to check it out.

item.title: GE Smart ConnectionCenter
item.description: Our new home has a very cool panel in the master bedroom closet.¬†The panel is made by General Electric and is called the GE Smart ConnectionCenter.¬†This unit brings everything from coaxial cable, home networking and telephone into a central point.¬†From there it redistributes it to all the rooms in the rest of the home.¬†Every room has multiple networking drops and coaxial cable.¬†A nice touch in the panel is the video amplifier¬†which should help minimize signal loss when the coaxial cables are split in th panel.

item.title: Barely Alive
item.description: Well after this week‚Äôs battle wth the flu, I am finally getting back on track.¬†I‚Äôm still really worn out though.¬†I pride myself in rarely getting sick.¬†Heck,¬†it was just a couple of weeks ago that I was bragging to my Dad about only using one sick day in the last 10 years at Microsoft.¬†I think this is the first time though in my adult life that I‚Äôve ever had the flu and it definitely was a doozie.

item.title: Real Estate Update and The Flu
item.description: All of the contingencies for our home sale were removed yesterday.¬†The contigencies we put in place on the new home that we‚Äôre buying will also be removed today.¬†It looks like evertyhing is moving forward just fine.¬†(knock on wood). One minute our home was sold, then the next the other the deal would fall through.¬†Truth be told our home actually sold three times until the deal was finally done.

item.title: Josie Trying To Be Like Her Dad
item.description: Tonight I got home a little after 5:00 pm.¬†Which is early for me, what was nice is that there was still some light out and I was able to get out with Josie tonight and help her with her skateboard. For those not following along at home I was a skate in my younger years and last year started to get our youngest daughter into skating.¬†She did pretty good last year learning the fundamentals, but to be honest she was a little young.

item.title: Scoble Intel LinkGate 2007 ‚Äì Bootstrapping a new business via blogs
item.description: It is with great interest that I am watching the discussion surrounding Scoble LinkGate 2007.¬†For those not following along at home, Robert blew a gasket this weekend when his exclusive video coverage of the Intel 45 Nanometer announcement did not get links from Slashdot.org, Engadget or Gizmodo.¬†The result of course is that TechMeme is full of discussion on this today.¬†Robert continues to pile on today with his pissing off the blogosphere post.

item.title: Home Sold Again
item.description: Ok, our house went back on the market yesterday after the original deal fell through.¬†Within hours we had another offer and have accepted it.¬†I think I‚Äôm going to stop blogging about our home sale until we‚Äôre closed. üôÇ¬†Needless to say we‚Äôre happy that this is moving along again. technorati tags: home+for+sale, sammamish+plateau, jeff+sandquist, sammamish, real+estate

item.title: Estevan Weather Vs. Sammamish Weather
item.description: Photo Credit: Prairie Blizzard by Ginnia It may be cold here today in Sammamish at 20 degrees Fahrenheit (-7 degrees celcius), but it doesn’t come anywhere close to Estevan where I grew up.   Estevan right now is at -6 Degrees Fahrenheit (-21 degrees celcius).  That temperature is actually a high for Estevan this week.  Dad was telling me the other day that it was down to -31 celcius most days.

item.title: Jon Udell is looking to meetup next week
item.description: Jon Udell begins his first week on our team and is looking to meetup with his new fellow softees.My new job at Microsoft starts Monday, and I‚Äôll be on campus in Redmond all week. The first 1.5 days are all HR stuff I‚Äôm told, but after that I‚Äôll be available. I‚Äôm setting up various meetings, but of course I don‚Äôt know many of the folks I ought to meet. So if you‚Äôre one of those folks, would like to get together, and are within earshot of this blog, speak up.

item.description: Greetings from Las Vegas.¬†I am down here with the folks from my Channel 10 team covering CES.¬†For the last two weeks we‚Äôve been very busy, interviewing all the folks behind the key Microsoft announcements that you‚Äôll see during tonight‚Äôs Bill Gates keynote.¬†(live streaming link) We will start shipping out content once the keynote goes live tonight.¬†Lots of fun surprises, check them out at http://on10.net In addition to the Microsoft coverage, we‚Äôll be sending up videos each day from the event covering what we find cool and interesting from the tradeshow floor.

item.title: Scoble Hates 5 Things
item.description: Ok, so Robert hates the 5 things meme¬†and so does Hugh.¬†Maybe I am a sap, but I‚Äôve really enjoyed it.¬†A number of folks tagged me and I enjoyed responding back.¬†Even more important I was able to learn a few more things about the bloggers I read and friends. What makes it interesting to me is that even though many of us write about the adventures in our lives in detail and we seem to watch each other live through transpaency, it really only goes so far.

item.title: Welcome Stephanie Quilao to Microsoft Evangelism!
item.description: We‚Äôve got another great addition to our team this week, Stephanie Quilao.¬†Stephanie will be joing our field team as an Enthusiast Evangelist just like Miel VanOpstal did prior to the New Year.¬†Stephanie will work out of our Northern California office conducting her activities in the San Francisco office.¬†As part of her job she‚Äôll be helping create content for Channel 10.¬†Thanks for joining us Stephanie.¬†Definitely fun things ahead of us this new year in Evangelism at Microsoft.

item.title: Our home in Sammamish, WA is now sold!
item.description: Well, that was quick.¬†As I mentioned previously we‚Äôre putting our home up for sale¬†(the for sale sign went up on December 30th) and in the last 48 hours we‚Äôve had 5 families through the home.¬†I was surprised to see this much traffic over New Years Eve and day, but the Real Estate agent said New Years day can be a popular day for homes to sell.¬†The flow did keep me optimistic and I figured we‚Äôd get an offer quickly, but wow what a thrill tonight we received an offer and have accepted.

item.title: The For Sale Sign is now up on our home in Sammamish
item.description: As I mentioned in my previous post we‚Äôre selling our home.¬†In fact the fellow from Sign Pro just left after installing the for sale on our front lawn.¬†I‚Äôve been surprised at the number of inquiries we‚Äôve gotten just from my initial post.¬†One of the advantages of having a decent Google page rank on my blog is that my Sammamish Home for sale post is now one the first page of results for a variety of relevant queries on both Google and Live.

item.title: Home For Sale in Sammamish, Washington (Sammamish Plateau)
item.description: We’re selling our home.   As I mentioned in [my 5 things about me post][1], we’ve decided to look for a larger place to make things more comfortable when my parents come in town to visit.  Although I am excited about the possibilities in getting a larger place, it will be hard to say goodbye to this place.  We are the original owners, buying the home new in the fall of 2000.

item.title: Seattle Wind Storm ‚Äì Our Power Came Back On
item.description: Just a quick note to say that I am very thankful that our power came back on last night around 8:00 pm.¬†A couple of days before Puget Sound Energy said it would.¬†This whole experience has gotten me to think a lot about proper disaster preparedeness.¬†With living on the plateau we try to keep extra supplies on hand, some cash and even some MREs.¬†Expect a follow up post soon with some ideas on how we can be better prepared at home and also on a local level soon.

item.title: Seattle Wind Storm
item.description: We‚Äôre on day four without power¬†to our home in Sammamish after the terrible windstorm that hit the sound on Thursday night.¬†As of this morning our home is still without electricity or phone service (mobile or landline).¬†Last night was a cold one with no heat in the house and temperatures outside dropping below freezing.¬†Lines at the gas stations where there is power are over a mile in length.

item.title: Estevan Gets Clean Power
item.description: I received a happy email from my mom tonight where she said my hometown of Estevan, Saskatchewan has been selected for a possible clean coal project.¬†Estevan is know as the Energy Capital of the province of Saskatchewan.¬†The area is rich in natural resources like oil, natural gas and coal.¬†Currently it has two major power generating facilities with Shand and Boundary Dam.¬†This would be its third, but I assume Boundary Dam would be decommisioned if this went forward.

item.title: ClearContext on Channel 10
item.description: If you‚Äôve read my blog for anytime you‚Äôll know I‚Äôm a Getting Things Done fanatic.¬†Probably my most popular blog entries of all time are Kicking the your inboxes butt ‚Äì Part 1 and 2.¬†I‚Äôve recently moved to the ClearContext product from NetCentrics Getting Things Done Add-In.¬†I absolutely love the ClearContext product.¬†Laura on the Channel 10 team recently got a great demo of ClearContext running on Office 12.

item.title: Come on over to the Community Bar
item.description: One of the things we‚Äôve heard loud and clear at Microsoft is that people love participating in our technical communities.¬†It has been an amazing thing for customers and really for us as a company.¬†People get to connect with us online, they get to know the humans behind our software and get questions answered by either by us or by their peers.¬†I consider myself so lucky to be able to a part of this all.

item.title: Mervyn's Is Closing in Redmond

item.title: Expose Like Functionality for Windows Vista
