item.title: Where have I been?
item.description: A reporter once joked to me at a party that he could always tell when I was about to ship something as my blog would go without a new post for weeks and then ‚Äúpow‚Äù out would come a new hire to my team, a new web site like Channel 9, 10 or www.MicrosoftGadgets.com.¬†I do tend to go totally heads down on projects and then come up for air often in a very tired state.

item.title: Microsoft Channel 9 Version 4.0
item.description: It is hard to believe that with just 2 ¬Ω years behind us, we‚Äôre on our way to deliver the forth major update to Channel 9.¬†We hope this will be released in beta form in about a month.¬†We‚Äôre focusing on 4 things in this major release: 1.¬†Experience ‚Äì Ajax may be all the rage, but it might not necessarily be the best experinece for a message board and forums.

item.title: Viewing your Flickr Photos Offline with a WPF Application
item.description: We were having one our regular team demofest‚Äôs today and Jeremy Mazner (who just returned from parental leave at Microsoft) demonstrated a very cool WPF application that uses the Flickr API to show your photo collection.¬†It enables tagging, uploading and slideshows.¬†It rocks.¬†What is even cooler is that its written by Thirteen 23, not Microsoft. This is an amazing replacement for Flickr Backup a Java application that I have used for quite some time to keep a local backup copy of my Flickr photos.

item.title: Meet Larry Larsen our new 10 Lead
item.description: I updated my hiring post the other week to let people know we‚Äôve filled our 10 Lead position.¬†Today, we posted Larry‚Äôs application to 10.¬†Larry will start in the next two weeks and will help drive our content strategy for 10.¬† You have got to check out Larry‚Äôs home office¬†that he is in the process of relocating Redmond. üôÇ¬†And in other related news Rory is now all on board and starting to film content for Channel 9.

item.title: Vacationing at home, Channel 9 updates and more
item.description: My parents will arrive in town this Sunday from Canada to visit us for the next week.¬†I am taking the week off to spend some time with them and to vacation at home.¬†With business travel, work, new programs to launch and lots of other highly visible changes at work over the summer vacation got pushed aside.¬†Thank goodness I love what I do.¬†In saying all that I am taking the next week off to spend some time with my family and am so excited to see my folks.

item.title: Steve Ballmer on Europe
item.description: You‚Äôve got to love Steve, great sense of humour. In a recent CNET Article when asked, ‚ÄúCan we talk about Europe?‚Äù Steve responds, ‚ÄúBeautiful place. I lived in Brussels for three years as a kid. I do love Brussels.‚Äù üôÇ

item.title: MSN Soapbox Beta Invites
item.description: Looking to try out MSN Soapbox?¬†We‚Äôve got beta invites over on 10 and an interview with Rob Bennett from the team. The thing that really impresses me with Soapbox is the video quality.¬†I‚Äôve used You Tube in the past but was very dissapointed with the video quality in that the compression makes the videos almost unwatchable.¬†Soapbox appears to not be grainy a you tube.¬†We‚Äôre looking for folks to create their own videos for 9/10.

item.title: New Toys for Channel 9 and 10
item.description: I wonder what fun [Rory][1] will have with [chroma key][2].  Expect lots of interesting stuff for 9 and 10 soon with this little addition.  More details on specs, etc later. technorati tags: channel+9, 10

item.title: Logitech Harmony 890 Remote
item.description: For quite some time I‚Äôve been a huge fan of Harmony Remote Controls.¬†As a passionate customer I think I‚Äôve personally sold at least 10 of these remotes to friends and most likely even more through this blog.¬†(Check out this mini review of the Harmony 880) Well the 880 has been retired in our home and I‚Äôve moved up to the Harmony 890 remote.¬†The 890 is a bit more expensibe than the 880, but it was well worth the update.

item.title: Microsoft Zune Demo Video on 10
item.description: Duncan on my team recently received a Zune beta device and I got to play with¬†it the other day.¬†I‚Äôm really impressed with where the Zune is headed and am glad that Microsoft is getting into the game here.¬†We‚Äôve posted a demo video on 10 that shows the sharing experience for songs and pictures with the Zune.¬†We‚Äôll also be interviewing folks from the Zune team next week.¬†If you have question ideas for the interview please leave them in the comment thread on 10 here.

item.title: Rory Blyth on Channel 9
item.description: A [fun interview][1], just posted to Channel 9.

item.title: Channel 9.next and 10
item.description: For a good part of the summer my team has been working hard to get the 10 code ready so that it can become a core platform for Channel 9.¬†It has been a lot of work, refactoring the code, getting the right infrastructure in place.¬†We really want to nail the next Channel 9 update and build something that sets us down the right path for the future of our network of sites.

item.title: We're Hiring!Come join the Channel 9 and 10 Team
item.description: Yes!¬†We‚Äôre hiring, we have a number of open positions on the Channel 9 and 10 team.¬†One key opening is a leadership on my team. In this <a title=http://members.microsoft.com/careers/search/details.aspx?JobID=04F207A7-8676-43C2-AEB8-63BEF87770C1&start=1&interval=10&SortCol=DatePosted href=“http://members.microsoft.com/careers/search/details.aspx?JobID=04F207A7-8676-43C2-AEB8-63BEF87770C1&start=1&interval=10&SortCol=DatePosted">lead role the successful candidate will be responsible for strategy, planning and execution for Microsoft 10 along with Microsoft‚Äôs global Enthusiast Evangelism efforts. So instead of just a job description, I had Laura come and¬†film a segment for 10 where I talk about the role¬†so I could explain more about the job and how to apply.

item.title: All Corvette Show at XXX in Issaquah ‚Äì Bringing Car Shows to the Software Industry
item.description: Well, although I was invited this year to it I missed Foo Camp.¬†Too bad.¬†Turns out even our new Chief Software Architect Ray Ozzie was able to make time to go the event.¬†So my excuse of ‚Äúthe week getting away from me‚Äù really does not hold water.¬†Heck, if Ray can make it, how can I be too busy?¬†To be honest, it was an amazing week.¬†It was the first week since India and some vacation time where I really got back into the flow of things at work and man, what a great week.

item.title: Shel on Blogs and Naked Conversations
item.description: Shel Israel the author of Naked Conversations jumps in today after last night‚Äôs drama to add some good clarifying points on what the book actually said when it tried to define blogs.¬†A few snippets‚Ä¶Scoble gets into more blogging tussles than I do.¬†He‚Äôs also a lot more gracious about it than I am in most cases. The current one is about the definition of a blog began here and seemingly will end here.

item.title: Penny Arcade on 10
item.description: Laura and Duncan score and an interview with Mike and Jerry of Penny Arcade fame on 10 today. A number of folks from my team will be at the Penny Arcade Expo (PAX) this weekend.¬†Let us know if you‚Äôre going to be there too.¬†It is going to be a great event‚Ä¶ technorati tags: Penny+Arcade, on10

item.title: A Private Blog Is Still a Blog
item.description: I‚Äôve been wondering when the day would come after Scoble left Microsoft that I‚Äôd disagree with him enough to bring it up here.¬†There have been many days that I‚Äôve disagreed with him, but today is the day that I need to jump into the pool.¬†Robert takes issue today with Live Spaces and how they call something a blog where the access is restricted.¬†It culminates in an entry today about What is a blog?

item.title: Washington Post Referrer Spam?
item.description: I‚Äôm getting about 65-70 referrals a day from http://washingtonpost.com/wp-srv/world/rssheadlines.xml No links in that feed link to my site.¬†Is it spam? technorati tags: Washington+Post, spam

item.title: Meet the EvNet Development Team
item.description: [][1] Charles sat down with our development team to learn more about The Evangelism Network codebase.  This is the code the team has been hard at work creating since the launch of [10][2]. We’ll ultimately have one set of code for both Channel 9 and 10.  We’ll also make sure we preserve the unique flair and personalities of each site.  Jamie (long time Niner) sure seemed to like it¬†and even called the team heroes and wondered if evNet was for more than just 9.

item.title: National Corvette Homecoming and Customer Evangelists
item.description: The National Corvette Homecoming (warning webpage with background sound üôÅ ) has been going on for 26 years now and was held again over the weekend in Bowling Green, Kentucky.¬†You can connect with owners around the globe, get a plant tour and take a restoration seminar. The passion behind Corvette owners is stunning.¬†They attend events, have local clubs and go to things like this homecoming.¬†People from around the planet.

item.title: Corvette Montage Video
item.description: My favorite parts: The vette racing the sport bike, the blue vette doing a burnout and the Dodge Viper getting beat. Hat tip goes to [The Corvette Blogger][1]. technorati tags: Corvette, Speed

item.title: Rock Star Day at Camp
item.description: Dressed up for “Rock Star” day at camp.

item.title: Making Friends When Travelling
item.description: So, I‚Äôm back from my trip.¬†It was a trip of a life time.¬†We made so many new friends, learnt a lot more about students and saw some amazing use of technology.¬†Not just technology for technology sake mind you, stuff that really will change the world.¬†Charles on my team even wrote a poem about it. One thing I am reminded of when travelling abroad¬†is how friendly we are when we run into someone we think is from our homeland.

item.title: Windows Live Writer Test
item.description: We‚Äôll have a video on10 with the Windows Live Writer Team very soon. Tags: Windows+Live+Writer

item.title: Imagine Cup Winners Announced
item.description: _Drum roll please‚Ä¶ _ The Winners of the Imagine Cup for Software design is Italy!¬†Congratulations!¬†Brazil placed second and Norway third! As corny as it sounds congratulations to all who entered, you were all winners before this event ever started. You all amaze me. technorati tags: Imagine+Cup, India

item.title: Update from Delhi
item.description: So it has been almost 24 hours since my A little freaked out in Dehli post.¬†I was able to make alternative travel arrangements last night through corporate travel as there was a high probability that my flight out of Heathrow to Seattle could be cancelled on Sunday.¬†(The BBC news is reporting 40% of flights out of Heathrow right now are cancelled).¬†This does mean that I will be getting home about 24 hours sooner than planned, Saturday afternoon.

item.title: The Drive from Agra to Delhi
item.description: Now for something of a different pace.¬†The drive from Agra to Delhi.¬†It sort of reminded me of being in a high speed chase (not like I‚Äôve actually had experience with that personally).¬†I filmed this with my digital camera, background music courtesy of the cassette our driver was playing.technorati tags: Imagine+Cup, India

item.title: A little freaked out in Delhi
item.description: Ok, my wife is sleeping right now and I am sitting here in Delhi and what‚Äôs running through my mind is when my wife will hear the news about the terrorist plot being¬†thwarted in London.¬†Charles, Laura and I are watching the BBC news here in Delhi and are pretty freaked out.¬†The way we understand it now is that certain American airlines like United, Continental and American were targetted by terrorists.

item.title: Calacanis on one hit wonders
item.description: I think anyone who has completed a sucessful projects always wonder if their next one will meet the mark.¬†I remember when we were weeks away from launching Channel 9 Lenn Pryor and I were down in the parking garage of building 119 at Microsoft.¬†We were having a stress smoke and walking, wondering if we were actually creating something cool.¬†We wondered if our previous hits were our lasts.¬†I can relate a lot to this post.

item.title: Imagine Cup ‚Äì Day 3 ‚Äì We saw the Taj Mahal
item.description: Hello from day three of the Imagine Cup.¬†Today is our last day in Agra before we head back to Delhi early tomorrow morning.¬†Tonight they announce the top six finalists for the software design category.¬†I think the students are all a little nervous, all wondering how they will fare.¬†Lots of tension.¬†We had a little party last night in the¬†‚ÄúLeisure Mall‚Äù at the hotel to help them all blow off some steam.

item.title: Erik Meijer: Democratizing the Cloud
item.description: No description or preamble by me can do this video justice.¬†You‚Äôve got to watch it. Erik Meijer: Democratizing the Cloud technorati tags: channel+9,

item.title: Imagine Cup on Channel 9
item.description: So far we‚Äôve gotten 3 solid packes from the Imagine cup for 10 and four hours of interviews with students for Channel 9.¬†We launched the first video a few moments ago on Channel 9 that has Joe Wilson (Grand Pooba) of Imagine Cup walking us through the venue and giving us a bit of history on the overall event. technorati tags: Imagine+Cup, India ¬†

item.title: Imagine Cup Team USA for Software Design
item.description: The Software Design Folks from Team USA are blogging: Hello from Agra, Uttar Pradesh, India. Agra, is home to one of the world’s seven wonders, the Taj Mahal. We are staying in the Jaypee Palace Hotel, which is opulent to say the least. We will visit the Taj Mahal on Wednesday and some of the team members have already made forays into Agra city for shopping and sight seeing. Not to worry about them, they are actually accompanied by an escort AND an armed guard.

item.title: Imagine Cup Competition Categories
item.description: So its day one of Imagine Cup and everything is in full swing.¬†Imagine Cup is the largest student technology in the world.¬†The theme this year is¬†to ‚ÄúImagine a world where technology enables us to live healthier lives‚Äù.¬†While in India the students will¬†compete in a variety of categories including Software Design, IT, Short Film, Algorithm, Project Hoshimi Programming Battle and Interface Design.¬†In each category the contestants compete 24/7 deciding when to sleep, eat and/or work.

item.title: Windows Live Messenger To Call Home
item.description: I think in this world of cellphones, pervasive Internet connections we often get spoiled as travellers in how easy it is to keep in touch with our family.¬†So coming to India¬†I knew it would be adjustment¬†when I wouildn‚Äôt call home at night or use my mobile phone to see what‚Äôs happening at the home.¬†Then tonight when I was thinking it would be great to talk to Lauri and Josie and¬†I remembered the calling features of Live Messenger.

item.title: Safe from the Monkeys while in India
item.description: This is the view outside of my room in Agra.   The Imagine Cup is at the Jaypee Palace which is an hotel and venue for the event.  Lauri did tell me to watch out for the monkeys before I came down here so I had to chuckle at the sign on my door warning to keep it locked.  Lauri keeps telling me that you can never be too careful when it comes to monkeys in India.

item.title: Finally Here
item.description: Well after leaving Seattle Friday night at 7:00 pm we finally¬†arrived in Delhi this morning at 6:15 am Sunday local time.¬†We then had a driver take us by car up to Agra which was about a 5 hour drive through some of the most insane traffic I‚Äôve ever experienced in my life. It was an unbelievable drive, very surreal, I think my photos probably do more to describe the drive than words.

item.title: Arrived in London Safely on the way to Imagine Cup
item.description: [][1] We‚Äôre on our way to The Imagine Cup!¬†We arrived at Hethrow from Seattle at around noon today (local time).¬†This of course was 4:00 am on our body clocks so we were all a little messed up when we arrived.¬†There is a 7 hour layover here today and then we continue on to Delhi so I was able to have a nice hot shower, changed my clothes and feel great!

item.description: View it here¬†(amazing photo) technorati tags: Storms¬†

item.description: I love relaxing to Flickr.¬†Yeh, I am weird. Anyhow I was browsing the Vette tag on Flickr tonight and found this gem.¬†If you read the description it says, ‚ÄúFinal resting place for a stolen Corvette‚Äù.¬†Yikes‚Ä¶¬†üôÅ technorati tags: Corvette¬†

item.description: technorati tags: Dancercise, YouTube

item.title: India and Imagine Cup
item.description: Friday night, I‚Äôm off to India (my first trip ever to that country) for the Imagine Cup.¬†I really don‚Äôt know what to expect.¬†Connectivity permitting I definitely plan to blog about my experiences.¬†If you are a student competing in the Imagine Cup and read my blog (I know one or two of you do :-)) congratulations on making it to the final step and see you in Agra!

item.title: Om Malik on Live
item.description: Om Malik writes: Microsoft‚Äôs Live Spaces initiative is getting a lot of buzz today, and rightfully so. The mass-market offering marries instant messaging, social networking (sort-of), Microsoft gadgets and blogging into what could be Cup-a-noodles of social apps. Techcrunch notes that Microsoft is phasing out the MSN brand, in favor of the ‚ÄúLive. The post continues on to detail traffic and trend analysis worldwide for spaces.¬†The new Live Spaces does do a lot of interesting things and I just love the integration with Messenger.

item.title: The Digg Algorithm
item.description: Duggtrends points to an interesting article on the Digg Algorithm: Some of the factors: Who dugg your story Time of day Pace of incoming diggs Number of comments Number of views Negative feedback Moderator diggs I am a huge Digg.com fan and it always fascinates me how no matter when I visit the site, I always find something new and interesting to browse.

item.title: Live Clipboard: What, How and Why?
item.description: Charles on our Channel 9 team sits down with Paresh Suthar and Matt Augustine to talk about the Live Clipboard.¬†Don‚Äôt know what Live Clipboard is?¬†To get the meat check out Ray Ozzie‚Äôs original post entitled Wiring the Web.¬†As Ray puts it‚Ä¶ The idea was based on using a simple and consistent user model to wire-the-web that would assist individuals in creating their own mesh of interconnections ‚Äì both web-to-web and web-to-PC.

item.title: Windows Live Spaces is Live
item.description: The world‚Äôs largest blogging service just received a major upgrade and we‚Äôve posted a brief interview on 10.¬†I‚Äôll be honest, I never thought I‚Äôd use spaces and although I can‚Äôt imagine moving this blog there (yet) it really looks like a service I‚Äôd recommend to my mom or friends. Easy to use‚Ä¶ The integration with live gadgets is very hot‚Ä¶¬†I also like the permissions features‚Ä¶ Controlling my friends lists, giving access to only people who are on my messenger contacts.

item.title: Lego Mindstorms and Microsoft
item.description: I don‚Äôt know what it is about Legos and geeks, but there seems to be such a natural tie.¬†Everyone I know who is into software seems to also have had a fascination with Legos as a child.¬†My brother and I used to spend all sorts of time building Legos, this of course was pre-Mindstorm old school lego¬†long before the Mindstorm Robots.¬†It is really amazing what you can do with Legos now.

item.title: How to live happily with a great designer
item.description: Excellent Piece by Seth Godin. If you want average (mediocre) work, ask for it. Be really clear up front that you want something beyond reproach, that‚Äôs in the middle of the road, that will cause no controversy and will echo your competition. It‚Äôll save everyone a lot of time. On the other hand, if you want great work, you‚Äôll need to embrace some simple facts: It‚Äôs going to offend someone.

item.title: Cloning Clyde for Xbox Live Arcade
item.description: I just downloaded Cloning Clyde for Xbox Live Arcade this afternoon. I love it.¬†Its goofy and fun.¬†About time we got a decent Platform Game up on Live Arcade. You need to try this one out. Postscript:¬†Great interview with John Nielson one the folks behind Cloning Clyde is over on XBox360FanBoy.com technorati tags: Xbox+Live+Arcade, Cloning+Clyde, 7+Day+Software

item.title: Photosynth on Channel 9 and 10 ‚Äì 3D Flickr
item.description: Sean Alexande calls it the future of Flickr.¬†üôÇ¬†I just call it cool.¬†Just in case you missed this we launched two very cool videos yesterday for the Photosynth project from Live Labs on Channel 9¬†and 10.¬†On 10 we posted a video that highlights how you‚Äôll use Photosynth then on Channel 9 Charles digs into the architecture of how Photosynth was built.¬†We intend to do more joint content like this on 9 and 10, building a greater ties between the sites.

item.description: Just got this link from a friend Dennis via email.¬†My AirPower Wiki for tracking power outlets in airports just got a brief mention in the New York Times. (Registration Required)Power on the Fly At the departure gates in the Austin-Bergstrom International Airport, there are electrical outlets on the wall at the end of the windows. Unfortunately, they aren‚Äôt near the seats, so if you want to plug your laptop in, you‚Äôll have to sit on the floor.

item.description: Recently there were a bunch of benefit updates at Microsoft (yes, they brought the towel service back).¬†One nice addition are the new Starbucks iCup coffee dispensers that are now slowly getting installed across campus.¬† Duncan posted a video of this actually pretty cool for a corporate coffee machine 10 yesterday. üòâ¬†Adam has more details on the iCup in an previous post on his blog. technorati tags: Starbucks, Microsoft

item.description: _ Postscript: Unfortunately, the video has been removed from YouTube._ technorati tags: Recruiting, Microsoft

item.title: When you have a bad day ‚Äî make it your own‚Ä¶
item.description: For the last 20 years July 27th has been a very sad day.¬†You see July 27th is the anniversary of when my only brother died.¬†Rod was 21 years old and was killed in a head on collision while driving home to Estevan, Saskatchewan fro Regina.¬†This year marks the 20th anniversary. It happened during a really bad rainstorm when a truck hydroplaned, lost control and drove head on into his car.

item.title: AirPower is starting off great
item.description: I should be thankful that I got delayed in Minneapolis for 7 hours last weekend, otherwise I probably wouldn‚Äôt have came up with the idea for AirPower.¬†Wow, the AirPower Wiki has really taken off.¬†Once we get some further traction with it, I might code up a little DB or play with Wikitalk to automate it a bit.¬†But right now, the wiki is working great! This really got picked up faster than I had thought‚Ä¶¬†Here‚Äôs some links to the discussion‚Ä¶

item.title: Stand ‚Äì Rascall Flatts ‚Äì The Jeff Sandquist Theme Song
item.description: You know my wife teases me often that I am more Texan than her. :->¬†I grew up in the small prairie town of Estevan, Saskatchewan, Canada.¬†Where the primary industries are oil, farming and ranching.¬†Sounds a little like Texas to me.¬†No wonder I married a girl¬†from Dallas.¬†So it shouldn‚Äôt surprise you that I love good country music.¬†My favorite artist of all time has got to be Rascal Flatts.

item.title: Lego was at Microsoft
item.description: Lego was at Microsoft today, I missed it as I am up visiting family in Canada.¬†We‚Äôll have a video in the next couple of days on 10.¬†Erik gives you a sneak peak with the photos he took.¬†Postscript: Erik now has a post on 10 with his photos. Can‚Äôt wait to see the videos‚Ä¶¬†_Postscript: The video is now online on 10. _ technorati tags: Lego, on10

item.title: AirPower ‚Äì Documenting Power Outlets at Airports Around the Globe.
item.description: The AirPower Wiki is shaping up, based on feedback from the community I‚Äôm going with the Wiki and the Flickr photogroup. AirPower is where we‚Äôre working together as a community to document power receptables in airports around the globe.¬†You know what its like when you are travel, its getting easy to find Wireless Internet, but power can be hard.¬†So I started a Wiki to help track the outlets.

item.description: Jamie‚Äôs latest is now online:¬†Googlepark: The Party Plane.¬†(Source: Channel 9) technorati tags: Channel9, GooglePark

item.title: At home in Estevan, Saskatchewan
item.description: After a longer than planned trip back home, I finally made it back to what I will always call home¬†Estevan, Saskatchewan¬†around 1:30 in the morning last night.¬†It is great to be back home. I was able to catch some of the family this morning at a brunch for the reunion and said goodbye as they all made there way back to their new home towns.Just off of main street, Estevan, Saskatchewan.

item.title: Finding Power Outlets at Airports
item.description: So while I am delayed for my Northwest Airlines flight in Minneapolis (read the saga) I decided to startup a Wiki to help folks track power outlets at airports around the globe.¬†Give it a little time, I‚Äôll pour some love into it over the next little while.¬†If you find an outlet, please add it to the page. _Postscript:¬†Maybe as Scoble says a wiki is the wrong idea¬†for this.

item.title: Northwest Airlines is late
item.description: Ok, very interesting day today in watching customer service in action.  If you know me, I’m a glass is half full kind of guy. Not today. Today, I am returning from Orlando and making my way up to Minot, North Dakota.  My parents live in Estevan, Saskatchewan which is about two hours north of that.  The Canadian Sandquists are having a family reunion tonight with folks coming from all around the country.

item.title: Microsoft MGX and Channels 9 and 10
item.description: ![][1] Well, today for me marks the end of a pretty amazing week and the beginning of a big year for my team at Microsoft. I’ve been down in Orlando, Florida all week attending MGX.   MGX is an internal Microsoft conference for our global sales folks and our Evangelists worldwide.¬†We use MGX to celebrate the accomplishments of the last year and communicate the strategy for the coming year to our teams around the year.

item.title: Microsoft 10 Version 1.0 is now online
item.description: After a late night and a team in two different time zones (I‚Äôm in Orlando, Florida attending an internal conference) we shipped a major update to 10.¬†Links: Me on 10 ‚Äì Welcome to 10 Version 1.0 Jesse ‚Äì 7 Day Software, featuring Newsgator Scoble ‚Äì Up Early to Watch the 10 launch Tina ‚Äì San Diego to Alaska with a blog, a camera and two wheels Michael Gannotti ‚Äì Is 10 a 10 We did learn a lot on our way to this release.

item.title: The 10 Commandments of Email
item.description: [][1] Along with the 5 Temptations of a CEO, the 10 Commandments of Email is another great read.¬† Don‚Äôt use your in-box as a catchall folder for everything you need to work on. Read items once, and answer them immediately if necessary, delete them if possible, or move them to project-specific folders. Set up a ‚ÄúFive Weeks Folder‚Äù that deletes its content automatically after five weeks. Use it as a repository for messages you‚Äôre unsure about, such as that email you want to delete, but you‚Äôre not sure if the guy‚Äôs going to call you tomorrow and ask about it.

item.title: 7 Day Software on 10
item.description: Back in 2004 I wrote about how if a piece of software is good enough for seven days, I‚Äôll buy it.¬†Since then a number of other bloggers have picked this up as way to talk about good, quality software and services. The idea is that once you‚Äôve used a piece of software for seven days you‚Äôll know whether it is a keeper or not.¬†In fact that is about the point that I decide to uninstall and never use sofware again if it is a dud.

item.title: Frogger is coming to the XBox Live Arcade
item.description: Saw this on Joystiq and over on Major Nelson so it must be true! Every Wednesday this summer the XBox Live Arcade team will release a new title. Kicking off with ‚ÄòFrogger‚Äô, fans of the Konami classic can download the game that first hit arcades in 1981 and once again be able to dodge traffic and eats flies with their frog, this time racking up Achievements along the way. There‚Äôs no better way to celebrate the 25th anniversary of Frogger and the launch of Xbox Live Arcade Wednesdays than downloading this latest title from the Xbox Live Arcade game portfolio.

item.title: Communities are Music Festivals
item.description: People throw the ‚Äúcommunity‚Äù word around a lot at Microsoft and throughout the industry.¬†To be honest it is not one of my most favorite words or phrases even though my team‚Äôs mission is creating places like Channel 9 and 10. I like to think of the end goal for sites like Channel 9 and 10 is to have something that resembles a music festival.¬†If you attend a music festival like Bumbershoot¬†or Farm Aid¬†what you notice right away is that often the most interesting aspects of the event aren‚Äôt always happening on mainstage.

item.title: Sharepoint Version 3.0 WPF 3D and Molecular Research
item.description:

item.title: Finally off to the beach
Fixing a Funky Mood With The Beach
item.description: I‚Äôm in a funky mood.¬†I was in San Francisco for most of the week on business for Microsoft and both my flight down and home were each delayed five hours due to mechanical difficulties.¬†Looks like my friend Omar also hasn‚Äôt had a great experience either from Alaska Airlines while flying from San Francisco.¬†There‚Äôs only so much you can do while stuck at the airport.¬†I ended up blogging a lot, reading and getting my inbox down to zero.

item.title: Creating a Log file with Windows Notepad
item.description: Disclaimer: I saw this on DIGG _the other day, but can‚Äôt find it via search this morning to attribute.¬†_ I am a Windows Notepad user, I use it throughout the day to keep running notes from meetings that I later consolidate into meeting notes and actions.¬†It works well.¬†I should probably use OneNote or something but I like the simplicity of a basic text editor like notepad.¬†So here‚Äôs one cool little trick for notepad that allows you to to automatically keep a simple date/time stamp in notepad as you open/add to a log.

item.title: The Five Temptations of a CEO
item.description: So last night at the recommendation of Jeff Erwin I picked up some of Patrick Lencioni‚Äôs books. I blazed through the Five Temptations of a CEO, it is a very quick read that you can easily get through in one sitting.¬†Really good, common sense advice.¬†The book is written as a short story that reminded me of David Chilton‚Äôs Wealthy Barber series. **The 5 Temptations of a CEO **

item.title: A treasure trove of Getting Things Done (GTD) Power Toys
item.description: Way back in January of 2005 I launched a basic wiki for folks into David Allen‚Äôs Getting Things Done Methodology.¬†I haven‚Äôt done much with it, so I was surprised to see how it has grown considerably.¬†The tools page is full of all sorts of cool applications¬†(PC | Mac | Linux) to help you get things done! This page¬†appears to be a rare example in an online community where if you build it they will come.

item.title: Practicing Leadership with Patrick M. Lencioni
item.description: Some really good coments over on Scoble‚Äôs post about leadership.¬†I‚Äôve never been a big fan of the term management, I prefer leadership.¬†Managers have subordinates, leaders have followers. In one of the comments Jeff Erwin recommends Patrick M. Lencioni‚Äôs books on leadership.¬†He writes:‚ÄúMy best advice is to go purchase all five books written by Patrick M. Lencioni and read them each twice. This will take you about one day to do, they are fast reads and very interesting.

item.title: ÔªøAlexander Gounares ‚Äì Bill Gates' Technical Assistant on Channel 9
item.description: Charles Torre on Channel 9 writes:ÔªøAlexander Gounares has one of the most interesting jobs in the world. For the past two years he‚Äôs been Bill Gates‚Äô technical assistant. In this, Scoble‚Äôs last interview for Channel 9 (you will see earlier interviews of Scoble‚Äôs in the near future, but this was his last one behind the camera for C9..), Scoble and Alexander talk about everything from why Alexander elevates his monitor with reams of paper to what working with Bill Gates was like.

item.title: Meet the 10 Team
item.description: [][1] A little while back myself and a few folks from my team sat down to talk about who we are, [10][2] and what the heck we’re trying to do with the project.  Its been one of the hardest projects I’ve had to be a part of since coming to Microsoft.  Its a new audience for me, we’re building infrastructure from the ground up to support [Channel 9][3] and [10][2] and finally we’re building a global team to support the whole thing.

item.title: Being a part of history ‚Äì Bill Gates and Steve Ballmer
item.description: This fall will mark a decade for me at Microsoft.¬†I spent sometime as a contractor and nine years as a full time employee so through that I‚Äôve been a part of some pretty darn special moments.¬†This morning though probably has and might go down as the biggest for me.¬†Charles and I had the privilege to sit down with Bill and Steve for a brief interview on Channel 9 discussing Bill‚Äôs next steps and his plan to move to his foundation full time in 2008.

item.title: Managers and Startups
item.description: Two quick hits tonight for you üôÇ For the Techies building teams ‚Äî TechieManager.com¬†(Hat tip: Kim Greenlee) For those entering the startup land ‚Äì StartupNation.com I listened to Startup Nation Radio¬†this past weekend on 770 AM in Seattle for the first time.¬†Loved it, good practical advice especially their Elevator Pitch section.¬†The show is also available via a Podcast.¬†One of my favorite business programs though of all time is CBC‚Äôs Venture¬†which goes behind the scenes in all types of businesses from startups, mom and pops and corporations.

item.title: Best Wishes to my friend Robert Scoble
item.description: A little over three years ago Robert became a close member of my family. item.title: G&S Fiebreflex Old School Boards
item.description: I started skateboarding when I was six years old.¬†This was when I was also riding BMX freestyle and riding motocross.¬†I‚Äôve always wanted to live my life a little on the edge.¬†Now that I have kids and think about my passions from the past, I wonder how my parents slept at night, wondering if a trip to the ER was on the agenda for the next day.¬†This morning Josie and I were digging through old photo albums to see if I could show her a photo of her dad doing handstands or a 360 on a half pipe when I was six.

item.title: Taking back my blog ‚Äì the fastest year
item.description: Robert‚Äôs recent blogging about life, his family and more has gotten me to think a lot about what I write here.¬†Every since joining Microsoft almost 10 years ago life has been moving forward at an exagerated pace.¬†In the last 12 months that has intensified even great.¬†Through this past year I have not made any time for blogging aside from an occasional I‚Äôm hiring post and a ‚Äúhey guess what¬†my team has done entry?

item.description: ¬†¬†The keebler elves were up late last night and delivered us a major site update for 10.¬†In our second sprint for we includeded a homepage that ties together the whole site (blogs, media, news), a media library and some modifications to our commenting system that allow the video stay in a fixed position.¬†This allows you to truly watch the video and view/reply comments at the same time.

item.title: After 10 ‚Äì We're going to MIX!
item.description: So what do you do after shipping a new enthusiast show and blogging community?¬†You go to mix. üôÇ You know, if you‚Äôre like me you hate the chore of packing for a conference making sure you have all the right sync cables, a charger for your phone, games for my PSP, music transferred to my music player.¬†Do I really need all this stuff? It is only a 2 hour flight to Vegas from Seattle, but I really feel naked without my devices.

item.title: On 10 Today
item.description: Lots and lots happening over at 10¬†today.¬†Man, what a week ‚Äì just crazy, the site is up and running great, we‚Äôre listening to the feedback on content and finding our center all while getting ready for MIX! What‚Äôs happened today? We‚Äôve posted a video interview with the folks from Puget Custom Computers, we‚Äôve commissoned them to built a kick-ass PC for a lucky member of the 10 community.

item.title: Microsoft 10 is now on the air
item.description: My team and I have been working night and day for some time to launch an all new community called 10. Our dream is to create a place for those people who want to use technology to change the world. Every weekday at 10:00 am (PST) we‚Äôll update 10 with a new video that highlights people, their passions and often the technology they are using. At the end of each week we compile these videos into a full length show with some extra surprises for you.

item.title: 10 ‚Äì Last Vignette Posted
item.description: The last vignette for 10 just went online¬†featuring Laura and Tina¬†who are two new members of our team.¬†We‚Äôre in launch mode as we speak, its been a wild ride.¬†We will bring the real thing online soon.¬†This is defintely different than anything I‚Äôve ever worked on before. üôÇ ¬†

item.title: Making a list checking it 10 times
item.description: Robert hinted recently on his blog that our team is working towards launching some new things.¬†Its all really exciting and at the same time totaly exhausting. When in ship mode I find myself in a machine like state, focussing on lists and of course my ‚Äúnot so secret weapon‚Äù GTD¬†in order to stay sane.¬†You know what?¬†It sort of works. üôÇ¬†(That and adrenalin) One of the great things about my team though is that everyone has an active blog.

item.title: Only in Seattle Wind = Breaking News
item.description: Ok, this just in ‚Äî breaking news in Seattle!¬†Windy Weather, watch out üôÇ Seriously, is this breaking news?¬†üôÇ I remember when I was kid in Canada we‚Äôd brave -40 degree temperatures (-90 with wind chill!) just to have a snowball fight!¬†Those temperatures meant that if you left skin exposed you would need medical attention.¬†But here its windy so there is a breaking news alert?¬†Ok, now I sound like one of those old chaps who had a harder life than you when they were kids.

item.title: NBC Cancels 'West Wing' After 7 Seasons
item.description: NBC is cancelling The¬†West Wing. item.title: Lauri is blogging again

item.title: Paul Reviews the Google Pack
item.description: Paul reviews the Google Pack¬†and his conclusion is:While virtually every computer company on earth is scared to death of Google, and virtually every PC user seems to be in love with them, Google Pack serves nicely as a reality check. item.title: I want my Boomerang TV!
item.description: Man, Josie and I noticed over Christmas that Boomerang¬†is now available via Comcast On Demand in our neighborhood.¬†(On Demand -> Kids -> Boomerang).¬†Boomerang has all those great classic cartoons (that used to be on Cartoon Network) like the Jetsons, Flintstones, Scooby Doo and more.¬†Stuff I grew up on Saturday mornings or lunch time home from school (our local TV played Flintstones for years at noon) So far Comcast hasn‚Äôt brought it on nationally as a channel, the DSL Reports Comcast Forums¬†are saying that most areas now have it as On Demand, but only Atlanta (where Turner Broadcasting is based) gets Boomerang in its full channel 24/7 glory.

item.title: 2006 Resolutions
item.description: Rick puts it best in this classic piece, my favorites are: Turn down a big VC firm. Randomly pick a super large VC firm, hit the about our people page, find the ‚Äúassociates‚Äù, and send one a letter declining to allow the firm to participate in your next fund raising. Make it all official like, use buzz words like synergy, web 2.0 personification, and mention that, ‚Äúfrankly that associate of yours really didn‚Äôt understand basics of recurring revenue on a recursive basis.

item.title: Windows Local is now Live
item.description: They are talking about it on memorandum here, you can play with the site at http://local.live.com and of course learn more on Channel 9 in this video. I was very pleased to see how up to date the imagery is.¬†We painted our house in the middle of September and the bird‚Äôs eye view photographs include our new home color so they must have been taken pretty recently.

item.title: Why Food Doesn't Matter Anymore
item.description: If IT doesn‚Äôt matter anymore, food probably doesn‚Äôt matter any more either.¬†Read this classic.

item.title: Channel 9 Now Has Shows!
item.description: We added a new feature to Channel 9 last night called shows.¬†We‚Äôll be using this feature as a way to group content on Channel 9 that going beyond our current use of tags.¬†We found that we were using tags to do groupings of videos and podcasts (e.g. The IIS Shows, ArcCast, Going Deep) when they really are much better used to organize our content by technology.¬†With the introduction of shows we can do the grouping in a more logical way and still tag each individual show by technology.

item.title: Happy Thanksgiving
item.description: Happy Thanksgiving!¬†In addition to this being a turkey day at our house we also use this day to decorate our home for Christmas.¬†A big part of this is setting up the Christmas tree.¬†Each year we add a few ornaments to the mix that tie into key things that have happened this past year.¬†Some are homemade by the girls or my wife others are purchased at the store.

item.title: Why are my eyes bloodshot?
item.description: Adam and I were up really late last night and it wasn‚Äôt because we were partying for Halloween.¬†We shipped a major update for the http://MicrosoftGadgets.com¬†website.¬†Shipping software is fun, but doing it when you have a fixed date (like a certain San Francisco event that can‚Äôt be moved) makes it even more enteraining and of course stressfull.¬†Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll find in this latest update: The Gadget Gallery‚Äì This is the gallery for http://live.

item.title: Channel 9 at EB Games in Redmond Town Center
item.description: I can’t wait!  Only 24 days until the [XBOX 360][1] is here. [Robert Scoble][2] and I will be at the EB Games in [Redmond Town Center][3] around 11:00 pm on November 21.  We’ll be handing out [Channel 9][4] guys, filming some video and of course picking up my XBOX 360. Then we’ll head back to my place and hook it all up and play some games.  You know I am soooo looking forward to the XBox 360 and its not just for the games.

item.title: The Blog Spammers have won ‚Äî goodbye referrers
item.description: I‚Äôve upgraded to Dasblog and have came to the same realization as my friend Omar.¬†The spammers have won Trackbacks and referrers are now the domain of disgusting text. A feature of blogs which was once useful is now ruined. All to build great Google page rank for their ‚Äúservice‚Äù. I‚Äôve removed trackbacks and referrers from my template.¬†In¬†their place I now have a link below each post labelled Other blogs commenting on this post.

item.title: Testing dablog 1.8
item.description: Testing Dasblog 1.8¬†, It worked!

item.title: Introducing the Channel 9 Clipster
item.description: Hey we just launched a new feature on Channel 9, we call it The Clipster.¬†Its like a PVR for Channel 9 that we‚Äôve integrated into our embedded media player.¬†It is really easy to use, we‚Äôve added a red record button to the embedded video player on Channel 9.¬† Select the red record button to start recording.¬†Select it again when you are done. Specify the title of the clip(s) you‚Äôve recorded.

item.title: Find HDTV Deals with a Start.com Gadget
item.description: Robert is looking for HDTV prices via search.¬†He should check out the new Start.com Gadget from MSN Shopping. 1.¬†Visit http://start.com 2.¬†Expand the sidebar to the left, and select Shopping under gadgets. 3.¬†Specify any set of keywords like HDTV 4.¬†Pin the Gadget to your Start.com page by selecting add to my page. This puts it in your face¬†if http://start.com is your homepage, heck there is evan RSS feed with results¬†too for your aggregator.

item.title: High Def Rocks
item.description: HDBeat, beat me to this, but if you‚Äôre watching ‚ÄúMy Name is Earl‚Äù on NBC on HDTV you‚Äôll be able to make out a sign in the background where a character is holding sign telling you the obvious, ‚ÄúHigh def rocks‚Äù.¬†If you watch this on a standard television you won‚Äôt be able to make out the details. I love my HDTV! ¬†

item.title: The Channel 9 Team Is Hiring
item.description: Ok, I am biased but I think I‚Äôve got the best team inside Microsoft and guess what, we‚Äôre hiring! First I‚Äôm looking for Developers who love the web and are experienced with ASP.NET, SQL, and CSS.¬†Your passion should be for shipping breakthrough user experiences on the web working as part of a team to help build sites like Channel 9, MicrosoftGadgets.com and even cooler stuff we can‚Äôt talk about yet.

item.title: Hotlink Pro ‚Äì Route IR Signals into A/V Cabinets
item.description: I just ordered the Hot Link Pro¬†from Smarthome.com, if this works all of my home theater components will be hidden away in a cooled entertainment cabinet.¬†This device will route the IR signals into cabinets, etc.¬†You know I‚Äôve tried cheaper IR emitters from Radio Shack and was dissapointed in the results as they would often drop signals sent via the remote. The hot link pro has gotten rave reviews out in the message boards.

item.title: Harmony 880 Remote
item.description: I recently purchased an Harrmony 880 remote, man what an excellent purchase.¬†Two pictures are worth a thousand words: ¬†Before After The Harmony 880 Advanced Universal Remote makes my home theater much easier to use as it combines the remotes for my XBox, Media Center PC, Plasma, Comcast HD DVR, Component Video Switchbox and Bose Lifestyle system into one remote.¬†I‚Äôve seen lots of universal remotes in the past but there are few things that make this one a buy in my house.

item.title: A post PDC toy for me
item.description: Ok, back home from PDC05¬†and I just swung out to best buy to pick up a new toy.¬†It is a Logitech Harmony 880 remote and it is charging on the stand right now. I‚Äôll let you know how it goes once its charged and I can setup some macros.¬†The goal is here is to make it so my wife can just select Watch TV, Play Game or Watch Movie on the remote and it will automatically switch the plasma to the right setting, turn the cable box on and change the audio settings on my receiver.

item.title: 30 minutes and PDC is complete
item.description: We‚Äôre about done with the PDC, we‚Äôre in the core team room, listening to the Killers¬†and Scoble is propping a few more video to Channel 9 on PDC.¬†We‚Äôre exhausted, proud of the work that‚Äôs taken place to get us to this milestone¬†and after a short break, it will be back to Redmond to finish what we started and incorporate what we learnt from you at PDC. PDC is one way that our Evangelism team ‚Äúships‚Äù.

item.title: Come to the Niners Lounge in the BIG Room at PDC05
item.description: Robert, David, Charles, Adam and myself will all be at the Niners Lounge in the big room tomorrow (Thursday) at 1:30 pm until 2:30 pm (or as long as there are people there). We‚Äôll bring along the big nine guy costume, maybe have a few t-shirts to give out and chat. Hope to see you there‚Ä¶ Tags: PDC05 ¬†

item.title: Channel 9 Videos Playing inside the Venue
item.description: Have you seen the cool application running inside the PDC?¬†Its built on Avalon and combines session data, show announcements, Channel 9 videos aligned with the event and finally attendee photos.¬†The data is consumed from RSS feeds that we created for the event. Joe Smith and Ernie Booth are the folks behind the code of the application.¬†Remember Vibe from the last PDC?¬†This application in Avalon took the most popular used features from Vibe and is made available via the plasmas at the venue.

item.title: My New Favorite Song
item.description: Listen here¬†, stay tuned. üôÇ Tags: PDC05

item.description: Check out the pictures of the room that one of the blog / code your way to the PDC folks got ‚Äúupgraded to‚Äù. üôÇ More details here. Tags: PDC05

item.title: What is this?
item.description: Yes, you‚Äôll find out what this is, in the ‚ÄúBig Room‚Äù at PDC05. Tags: PDC05

item.title: News.com is tagging
item.description: Just noticed News.com now has a tag cloud.¬†Kind of a cool user experience where as you type a tag name it shortens down the resultset.¬†As we add more tags to Channel 9¬†we‚Äôll probably have to do something like this. Too bad they don‚Äôt have friendly URLs like http://channel9.msdn.com/tags/avalon and also they don‚Äôt include the rel=‚Äùtag‚Äù item to their links though. ¬†

item.description: Don‚Äôt forget to tag your photos and upload to Flickr as you make your way to PDC05!Tags: PDC05

item.description: Play Video: Josie’s First Day At School

item.title: Please Tag the PDC!
item.description: Are you blogging the PDC?¬†If you are, please take a moment and apply a PDC05 tag to your post and photos. How do I do this?¬†For your blog Just embed the following HTML: PDC05 (you can make the HREF value point to any URL you want), by doing this your post will be part of the ‚Äútagged web‚Äù and can easily be found. **For your photos ** If you‚Äôre taking photos and uploading to FlickR, check out the PDC05 Photo Pool¬†and also the PDC05 tag page, just tag your FlickR photos with ‚ÄúPDC05‚Äù and folks can see them at http://www.

item.title: Channel 9 Update
item.description: Where have I been lately?¬†Me and the team have been heads down getting an update to Channel 9 out the door. I‚Äôm really excited about this update.¬†We focused on making the site easier to use, simple to find things and also expand into other types of media types such as Podcasts and Screencasts.¬†My favorite part of all is our support for tags.¬†In the spirit of Technorati, Flickr and Delicous we‚Äôre supporting tags.

item.title: Where will you be sitting at the PDC?
item.description: Check out the best seats in the house post over on the PDC Team blog.

item.title: Scott on MSN Frameworks
item.description: [Scott writes][1]… From my previous few discussions on MSN and Frameworks, you may have guessed that we have a client framework infrastructure.¬†We are developing a framework to enable us to consistantly implement and integrate rich components.¬†To demonstrate how the MSN Frameworks will enable us to innovate quickly ‚Äì I built and shipped (beta quality üôÇ a new MSN Blog Map component within start.com.¬†The MSN Blog Map maps bloggers from throughout MSN (expect the list to grow over the next few weeks).

item.title: Reminder Plateau Blogger Meetup Tomorrow Night
item.description: Hope to see you there¬†at the Pine Lake Ale House¬†in Sammamish at 7:00 pm on Thursday, July 28.

item.title: Congrats Konfabulator + I need a Flickr Widget + PDC05 Flickr Pool
item.description: Congratulations to the folks at Konfabulator on being acquired by Yahoo! If you‚Äôve never used it, give it¬†a whirl (its now free) and the class act that they are, they are giving folks who bought Konfabulator 2.0 a refund. Now can someone please write a Flickr photoviewer like this for Konfabulator? Now that Yahoo! owns them (and since they also own Flickr) this seems like a no brainer. _Update: John in my comments for this post explains that the standard Konfabulator photo frame widget does support Flickr.

item.title: Cooters Pissed
item.description: Cooter is pissed:Former Georgia Congressman Ben Jones, who played ‚ÄúCooter‚Äù on the hit TV series ‚ÄúThe Dukes of Hazzard,‚Äù has blasted the new film version to be released in August as a ‚Äúprofanity-laced script with blatant sexual situations that mocks the good clean family values of our series.‚Äù In an open letter to the fans of the show on his Web site, Jones says that ‚Äúrather than honoring our legendary show, they have chosen to degrade it.

item.title: Flickr + Free Idea
item.description: I love Flickr, you know its fun just to browse the tags, you never know what you‚Äôll find. Like tonight I stumbled across this omniness machine. I find more and more I am finding amazing photos in Flickr. Free Idea: Write a kick ass Avalon Flickr Browser that allows me to browse and search¬†by tags.

item.title: Adam makes a sweet C9 Wallpaper
item.description: Adam who recently joined the Channel 9 team and is working like crazy to write code to make Channel 9 easier to use and do some pretty cool new things has made a very cool Channel 9 Wallpaper. Very cool! I hope this is part of a series.

item.title: MSN Desktop Search is a Seven Day Winner
item.description: I‚Äôm getting some heat by Ross Jones in the comments for my post about the MSN Screensaver that it requires the MSN Toolbar to function. Whilst I don‚Äôt want to rain on your parade isn‚Äôt putting functionality (search) on a screensaver fairly pointless? Do you tend to sit and try and use your computer when the screensaver is on? Personally the only time I ever see it is when I come back to my computer and press space to re-activate it.

item.title: Hot new MSN RSS / Search / Messenger Screensaver
item.description: This is hot, check out the MSN Screensaver Beta, cool screen saver, does RSS, weather even search.¬†The UI is simple, clean and kind of sexy.¬†I grabbed a screenshot, I can even keep up with Scoble on it. üôÇ I never thought about integrating messenger buddy status and search into a screensaver.¬†Feature Request: Allow me to publish photos from an MSN Spaces blog, that way I can install it on my mom and dad‚Äôs computer to share photos.

item.title: Backyard Photo Stitching Fun!
item.description: Man, this is fun! After reading Soma‚Äôs blog about Turning Ideas into reality‚Äù and the image stitching in Acyrlic I played with it.¬†‚Äúa cool photo-stitching feature in Microsoft Acrylic. Scanned images or photographs usually capture a limited amount of information, forcing us to take multiple scans/photos of a panoramic view or a large original image.Microsoft Acrylic provides one of the best image-stitching features by seamlessly combining multiple images. This feature was a direct result of our collaboration with MSR.

item.title: Channel 9 was at the moon
item.description: Zoom in¬†all the way¬†on Google Moon and you‚Äôll find out a big secret. The secret is that Channel 9 has already been to the moon and that is where we are stashing our 9 Guys. Send us a postcard and we‚Äôll send you a 9 guy! Hat tip to Scoble

item.title: Channel 9 Guy Road Trip to PDC05 ‚Äì Episode 2
item.description: Episode 2 just went online, check it out!

item.title: Plateau Blogger Meetup ‚Äì July 28th @ 7pm
item.description: Just a friendly reminder that there will be a Blogger Meetup in Sammamish at the Pine Lake Ale House on July 28th at 7:00 pm. If you‚Äôd like to put an appointment on your calendar so you remember, I‚Äôve created an ICS file for you below. [][2] Lots of folks have RSVP‚Äôd for the event and it should be a lot of fun, folks like [Robert Scoble][3], [Josh][4] and [Gretchen][5] Ledgard, [Rob Caron][6]¬†and whole lot [more][7]¬†and [more][8].

item.title: Rules of engagement for my team
item.description: My team at Microsoft is quite lively as it includes both the folks behind Channel 9 and Evangelists for both Visual Studio 2005 and also Longhorn. What I absolutely love about our team is the lively debates we have about strategy, technology and our overall direction as a team and company. The amazing thing is no matter how spirited the discussion gets or how much might disagree about an item, we aways leave the discussion as friends and with mutual respect.

item.title: Getting Things Done in Wired
item.description: How could I miss this? Marc Orchant¬†was interviewed by Wired on Getting Things Done. Thanks Dana for the link:Wired has two good articles on Getting Things Done. They also interviewed the GTD apprentice guru, Marc Orchant, who I had the pleasure of meeting at the Shareware Industry Conference this week. Thanks Marc for pushing us all forward on GTD. Marc Orchant posted his transcript from the interview with the Wired reporter and David Allen did as well.

item.title: The Podsafe Music Network has launched
item.description: This might be cool. the Podsafe Music Network has launched. I think this service gives us a way to have royalty free music for our podcasts. If I‚Äôm right then cool! Great way to give exposure to indy artists driving CD sales and also giving podcasters music for their podcasts. Hat Tip to Andrew Grumet¬†for the link. ¬†

item.title: Software as a service
item.description: I cut my teeth in .NET working with a fellow by the name of Garland Brown on a project where we wrapped Microsoft‚Äôs internal Siebel implementation as a web service. .NET Undocument writes an interesting history of the road to Getting Web Services: The notion of ‚Äúsoftware as a service‚Äù has gradually become a coherent and unifying story throughout Microsoft. I see it in the .NET framework support for web services and ClickOnce, in Indigo‚Äôs¬†attempts to unify the various Windows communications approaches into a simple, common services-based API, in¬†Avalon‚Äôs borrowing of UI patterns (deployment, inductive UI, markup, navigation) from the Web.

item.title: Jody Anderson our mural artist is back
item.description: Jody our family‚Äôs mural artist finally updated her weblog and man she‚Äôs been busy! Hey everyone‚Ä¶this post/update has been a loooonnnnngggg time coming. Life has been extremely busy between coaching, having fun, and of course mural jobs, like the Microsoft iWall, Nursery, Insight Creative, and my latest project Vision House. I‚Äôve added these to My Portfolio on the right sidebar. I‚Äôll be sure to post more frequently than every 6+ months and let you know what projects I have coming down the pipe as well as artwork I‚Äôm working playing with.

item.title: PDC05 Session Preview
item.description: Been waiting to register for the PDC, but wanting find out more about session details? Take a moment to peruse the almost complete list of sessions. More details over over on the PDC Team Blog. ¬†¬†

item.title: Write cool software, sell it, profit! :-)
Mikes Adobe Illustrator Weekend Project
item.description: On the weekends some people like to play sports, others like to go hiking, but Mike a Technical Evangelist on my team prefers to code. You see it was just a few Fridays ago, Mike and I were chatting about how cool it would be to have a plug-in for Adobe Illustrator that allowed you to export your illustrations as XAML. The following Monday morning Mike was emailing me XAML files originally created in Adobe llustrator and I was loading them into Chris Anderson‚Äôs XAMLPad.

item.title: Brynn Playing Poker?
item.description: Believe it or not Photoshop was not used in the creation of this photo. :->

item.title: Access an Exchange Address Book from Pocket PC
item.description: Sweet! Mike Hall fills us in on an awesome Power Toy for Windows Mobile. One of my frustrations with Windows Mobile is that sometimes I realize I want to send someone email via my Pocket PC, but don‚Äôt have their email address in my local contacts store on the device. If I only had access to my the Global Addreess Book stored on Exchange.¬†Now I do. Awesome! üôÇ Microsoft Global Contact Accessis a free power toy for Windows Mobile devices which enables you to look up contacts in the Global Address List (GAL) and check co-worker schedules.

item.title: Offsite Meets Foo Camp
item.description: We had a great offsite today for the Channel 9 Team. At Microsoft an offsite is a meeting where you take the team away from the normal settings and do some planning. Offsites serve as a a great way to get everyone away from email, the daily routines and devote a solid day to planning. From my previous experience at offsites you never quite know what you‚Äôll get out of an offsite.

item.title: Plateau Blogger Meetup ‚Äì July 28th at 7:00 pm
item.description: Lots of response to the Plateau Blogger Meetup Plan, here‚Äôs the scoop: Who? Bloggers, Geeks and their Friends What? Blogger meetup with wi-fi, beer and good food. **When? ** Thursday, July 28th at 7:00 pm. **Where? ** Pine Lake Ale House (425) 898-9099 640 228th Ave NE Sammamish, WA 98074 **Why? ** Because we can and its close to our homes :-> Please spread the word and RSVP via the comments on this post.

item.title: Sammamish Blogger Meetup Anyone?
item.description: We‚Äôve got the perfect place for a blogger meetup in Sammamish, The Pine Lake Ale House.¬†It has great food, free wifi and of course beer. üôÇ The question is, do we have enough nearby bloggers for a suburban blog meetup? üôÇ Please leave a comment if you‚Äôre interested and of couse spread the word via your blog. _Update! Thanks for all the response in my comments. Thursday, July 28th at 7:00 pm is a really good date for me and a few others I‚Äôve talked to about the event.

item.title: Watch Beth Code!
item.description: Sweet! Beth on my team is putting VB Express through its paces and blogging about it. It would seem only right that if I am going to be spending my time thinking, dreaming and breathing all things Channel 9, then I should probably know how to code my way out of a paper bag.  Unfortunately, the truth is my passion for technology has never moved beyond pure consumption of said technologies.

item.title: The New Mustang Rocks
item.description: I‚Äôm thinking (I repeat thinking) about buying a new car and am looking for something fun. Recently while in California I noticed a new mustang that had some styling effects and alluminum wheels that made it really stand out. Turns out the car was no ordinary Mustang, it was a Saleen Mustang.¬†A company with a long heritage of crafting beautiful cars, what Saleen does to the Mustang GT is amazing.

item.title: Baby Boom at Microsoft is Changing the Parties
item.description: Robert talks about the great part last night at Eric Ewings, man what a blast! These have been going on for years and for me each time it serves as reunion of sorts. The conversations were all over the map (not just Microsoft talk) Doug Seven¬†and I badgered Robert about how he is so wrong about the new Mustang. Kevin Briody and I talked about hosting some Blogger meetups on the Sammamish Plateau and Amy Sorakas¬†and Doug‚Äôs wife talked about wakeboarding injuries.

item.title: Channel 9 Steve Ballmer Interview
item.description: Today was a real fun day at work. Robert Scoble and I went over and interviewed Steve Ballmer for Channel 9. I‚Äôve been in meetings with Steve in the past once or twice, but nothing like this. We filmed the video in Steve‚Äôs office on Microsoft campus, Robert did a great job interviewing him and Steve was definitely himself. I don‚Äôt think we ever dreamt back in the day when we launched Channel 9 that we‚Äôd get Steve to do an interview.

item.description: I‚Äôm thinking about making the move to HDTV, in preparation for the XBOX 360 but am left with confusion. My hope is to purchase a 42‚Ä≥ flat panel / plasma television to hang on the wall in our family room. Questions‚Ä¶ What is the difference between HDTV and HDTV ready? What is Extended Definition? item.title: An update from Lenn Pryor
item.description: Powerful blog post from Lenn:We have decided to consider making Tallinn home, but have a little more thinking to sort out. Watching a country with a great and deep history and culture emerge from 50 years of soviet occupation is something quite amazing to see. The people are smart, well educated, hard working, kind if not a bit distant. They are also stunningly beautiful as a whole. It is a unique place with a unique culture and a unique language reshaping itself in a new era.

item.title: Playing with video blogging
item.description: <td noWrap> <img class=mediaplayerbutton onmouseover=hover(this); onclick="openPlayer('player',this);" onmouseout=out(this); alt="launch in external player" src="http://www.jeffsandquist.com/player/images/mediaplayer_FullScreen_h.gif"> </td> Its Josiedex today. I’ve been basically away from the house for the last two weeks travelling on business, attending an offsite and then Gnomedex. Mom and big sis are off to the movies so Josie and I are going to take her corvette for a spin.

item.title: Monorail, Monorail, Monorail for the Microsoft Campus
item.description: Found this little gem today [over on the Channel 9 Coffee House][1]: A couple of other ex-MS employees and I have created a futuristic animation of Microsoft campus.¬†Personal Rapid Transit (PRT) technology is a new transit technology under development and could be commercialized as soon as 2008.¬†PRT is a ‚Äúpacket switched people mover,‚Äù faster than a car.¬†Buildings 26-28, Troon, and Augusta were modeled for this animation, with PRT zooming around the buildings.

item.title: Why am I at Microsoft? RSS Everywhere
item.description: Scoble started a list awhile back of why he is at Microsoft¬†in response to Joel. For me its the people, the passion and the fact that despite some opinions of late we are getting stuff done. Dean and the rest of ‚ÄúMicrosoft‚Äôs Longhorn, Browing and RSS Team‚Äù (time for you to rename your blog) gave me yet another reason yesterday at Gnomedex. You can watch the video here¬†on Channel 9.

item.title: PDC05 Road Trip ‚Äì Episode 1
item.description:
Join us as we chronicle one guy‚Äôs journey to get to PDC 05 üôÇ
Technorati Tags: PDC05

item.title: I can't tell you what's in my office after all
item.description: So I made a post the other night about something that Steve Cellini and the PDC Team¬†had put in my office¬†while I was on the road. I was asking if someone could take a picture. I wanted to see what it was before I returned and share it via my blog. No one on my team would comply. I was more than slightly annoyed. Good thing they didn‚Äôt listen to me üôÇ It would have given away the surprise.

item.title: You go out of town for a few days and they do what to your office?
item.description: As I wrote earlier, I‚Äôm on the road with Sanjay visiting customers and connecting with our local Evangelists. It has been a great week so far, but quite intense. We‚Äôve been packing a lot into each day. From reading Steve‚Äôs blog tonight, it looks like I‚Äôve got a surprise waiting for me in my office.Also, today, a couple of us dragged what seemed to be a small yellow rectangular body / structure into Jeff‚Äôs office.

item.title: Hit the road Jeff
item.description: I‚Äôm on the road this week with my Great-Grand-Boss (at Microsoft that is what we call ones Boss‚Äôs Boss‚Äôs Boss) or Sanjay. It will be a whirlwind trip taking us from Chicago to Denver to San Diego to Santa Monica then home to¬†Seattle. All beginning with a 6:10 am flight Monday¬†morning.¬†Nothing beats getting out on the road and meeting with customers and I am really excited to go on this trip.

item.title: I love the Technorati Beta!
item.description: The Technorati Beta is hot. I love how on one page with a friendly URL I can have a view that combines blogs, photos from flickr and links from del.icio.us.¬†For example check out http://beta.technorati.com/search/pdc05¬†which combines all of these together for PDC05. item.title: Welcome to Bitman's Place

I started with a hangman style game on my Commodore 64 that was written in BASIC.¬†Then it was on to application that helped me memorize french verbs, next a variation of Pacman followed and the last program written on my Commodore 64 was a Bulletin Board System that used Assembly Language for speed and Basic for ease of customization.

item.title: Thank the solider part 2

item.title: Don't lose sight of where you come from
item.description: Recently while reading a hometown newspaper I stumbled across the painting to the right of the school I attended as a child. This painting by Gail Frasz brings back great memories of the small farming community of Benson where I grew up and went to school. I think the population back then was around 100 people. I spent most of my free time riding dirt bikes in the summer, snowmobiles in the winter and my horse Flash the rest of the time.

He would have asked you for ten cents admission and introduced you to his fantasy world carved out of stone. Interesting, check out the photo gallery¬†and an aerial photo.

item.title: Internet Anxiety Disorder Anyone?
item.description: Internet Anxiety Disorder ‚ÄìHat tip to Slashdot.orgWe live in an always on, ever connected world. My phone, wireless and wired rings constantly, and missed calls and voice mails pile-up even before the coffee stops brewing early in the morning. There are tips from sources, a friend on east coast on his way to work wanting to recap the Yankees game, and an occasional message of concern from mom! Time to boot up the computer and be greeted by an early morning assault of emails, sometimes as many as 100, and that‚Äôs before Sun‚Äôs first rays caress the Coit Tower.

We moved beyond a sneaker based network and enabled file sharing via a Novell file server and allowed folks to share printers amongst their workgroups.

item.title: The Podcast Link Blog
item.description: Question ‚Äî What is the easiest way to create a linkblog? I want to create a link blog that only contains individual podcasts that I find interesting. I‚Äôll turn 35 on June 29th of this year which means almost 20 years of this‚Ä¶ ¬†Here‚Äôs the¬†before photo‚Ä¶.

item.title: The Five F's of my Life

Lauri and I started doing this last year, we set goals around the 5 F‚Äôs, mapping out one year, five years and ten years.

item.title: Words cannot describe the 9/11 Exhibit at the Washington State Museum of History
item.description: My wife and I just returned from visiting the 9/11 Exhibit at the Washington State Musuem of History. It is an amazing tribute, being able to touch pieces of steel taken from rubble of the twin towers was moving, seeing pieces of the planes that struck the towers left me lost for words and watching a video that pieced together the news events from that day brought tears to the eyes of many including myself.

item.title: September 11: Bearing Witness to History
item.description: From January 30 ‚Äì April 24, 2005 there will be a 9/11 display at the Washington State Museum of History. This is a travelling exhibit created by the Smithsonian Institute. September 11: Bearing Witness to History brings together objects, images and personal stories that help recall this historic day and its impact on our nation. Photographs and moving images capture moments from the attack, and visitors confront powerful artifacts including twisted steel from the World Trade Center, damaged items from the Pentagon, memorials from the crash site in Pennsylvania, clothing worn by survivors, and objects used by rescue workers and public officials.

item.title: The Saga of Bob the Duck
item.description: Josie‚Äôs favorite Joke.. Bob the duck walks into a feed store and asks the guy at the counter, ‚ÄúGot any fish?‚Äù The guy at the counter responds, ‚ÄúSorry, we don‚Äôt, we only sell feed.‚Äù Bob the duck thanks the man and leaves the store. The next day Bob returns to the feed store and asks again, ‚ÄúGot any fish?‚Äù The guy at the counter responds, ‚ÄúAs I told you yesterday, we don‚Äôt sell fish, we sell feed.

item.title: Forcing Windows XP to Restart after connecting via a remote desktop connection

In order to ensure that machine is always running in the 10‚Äô User Experience it is configured to automatically logon using the Windows XP Tweak UI Power Toy¬†upon boot. This works well, but if I connect to the mahine via a remote desktop connection and then logoff, it leaves the computer with a Windows XP logon dialog.

item.title: Maybe I shouldn't sell my last Tivo

item.description: Tivo today released the TivoToGo feature that allows Tivo users to transfer television programs from their Tivo to a computer. When a solution from Sonic ships you will also be able to burn the transfered programs to DVD via the PC.¬†For more information I recommend this post on the TivoCommunity.com forum. item.title: Getting Things Done This New Year

Here are my posts: How I get things done / Kicking some butt on your email inbox ‚Äì Part 1

item.title: More ballots than voters
item.description: I had mentioned previously that I looked forward to Dino Rossi possibly taking on Maria Cantwell in ‚Äò06. With some of the recent discoveries I don‚Äôt expect Dino to concede any time soon now. Check out the following from Sound Politics: It was last reported that there were 3,539 more ballots counted in King County than voters who cast them. The discrepancy is actually much larger. The 3,539 is only the net.

item.title: Sucessful CEO's don't multi-task, they get things done!
item.description: Found this gem on Jim Grisanzio‚Äôs weblog‚Ä¶_I hate multitasking. Absolutely despise it. Always have. I‚Äôve poked fun at this idiotic notion of multitasking here, here, and here, too. And I try to ignore ‚Äî or at least placate ‚Äî people who tell me I should multitask more (as if I‚Äôm not forced to multitask enough already). Instead, I‚Äôm making a major effort to narrow my activities and focus focus focus. The more I do this the more relaxed I become and the more successful I feel.

item.title: Heart Smart Recipes for a healthy New Year
item.description: I get asked all the time now that I‚Äôve completed the first phase of 20/20¬†if I miss food? My answer, not at all, in fact I love it now more than I ever. The only difference is I can taste it because its not loaded up with sauces. I recently discovered a great show on the Food Network called the Calorie Commando. Meet Juan-Carlos Cruz, The Calorie Commando. Juan-Carlos believes that it is possible to eat heart-healthy without feeling deprived.

item.title: Excel Inspiration?
item.description: Digging through my referrer log after reading Julie Leung‚Äôs unexpected gifts amongst garbage post, I found an unexpected post from Dennis E. Hamilton talking about his recent weight loss¬†and how he employed a meal tracking spreadsheet like the one I use.But then Jeff Sandquist inspired me by his description of his 20-20 program.¬†I followed his blog posts from the beginning, but it was when he first showed his spreadsheet that it dawned on me.

item.title: I prefer the XDA III over the AudioVox
item.description: I‚Äôve got the AudioVox that Scoble talks about continously and am fortunate to also have the XDA III. I prefer the XDA III over the Audiovox. The slide out keyboard makes it great for¬†doing mail and its killer to have built in 802.11 support. After years of syncing a phone or putting up with slow GPRS, its empowering to use a Pocket PC on a high speed LAN. The Audiovox is a great phone and a great pric, but the screen is too small for¬†my¬†daily usage and I‚Äôve never gotten used to typing fast using the keypad.

item.title: Rossi for State Senate in 2006 ‚Äì Watch out Maria Cantwell
item.description: Here‚Äôs my last thought on the election in Washington State. If it is not obvious, I‚Äôm a big fan of Rossi. I love his pro-business outlook and what he did to keep this state from a distasterous California like budget shortfall through crafting of a miracle budget. As chairman of the Senate Ways and Means Committee, he drove around the state on a trip in which he tried to fashion a consensus of Republicans and Democrats on a budget that didn‚Äôt raise taxes and preserved programs for the elderly and developmentally disabled.

item.title: Sound Politics on Washington Governor RaceEyewitness Report from Chernobyl
item.description: While tracking the Washington States Governor race I discovered two excellent sites. The first is Sound Politics¬†which is political weblog and OrbusMax¬†which is¬†Northwest Drudge¬†Report like web site. I love OrbusMax‚Äôs slogan, ‚ÄúAround the work in 80k‚Äù¬†Hard to believe that the source of this lightweight site is greater in size than the memory on my first computer. üòâ Here‚Äôs a round up of interesting posts from Sound Politics.

item.title: Engadget nails why I got rid of my Tivos / No one wants to buy my Tivos
item.description: Ryan Block at Engadget writes: TiVo, listen up and listen good: these things have dual tuners (don’t even try and tell us it’s not necessary), they record HDTV, rock HD video on demand, and still do 60 hours of regular TV. And they cost the consumer nothing but an extra $10 per month. I loved my Tivo before getting the Comcast box. I’ll be honest I would not want a Comcast box without the Microsoft software so phone Comcast and say I want my Microsoft powered DVR!

item.title: Make sure all the Washington State Votes were counted
item.description: On the radio tonight I heard a story that many absentee votes from our troops overseas were not counted in the Washington State Governor election. This is a slap in the face for folks who‚Äôve volunteered to fight for our freedom around the globe. If you have a moment please take the time and call the Washignton Secretary of State Sam Reed¬†at 360‚Äì902‚Äì4151.¬†Let him know that we need to count these military ballots as well.

item.title: Switching Mobile Phone Carriers and Keeping Your Phone Number Works
item.description: I changed from Cingular to T-Mobile this last week and kept my phone number. It was easy and it worked! Here‚Äôs all I had to do: Let my service contract for Cingular end so I could move on. I called T-Mobile and told them my Cingular phone number and Cingular Account Number T-Mobile sent me a new SIM chip (I have an XDA II phone that is unlocked so all I needed was the chip) Replaced the Cingular SIM chip in my phone with T-Mobile and it worked with my original phone number.

item.title: Current Electoral Vote Predictor 2004
item.description: I can‚Äôt vote tomorrow because I‚Äôm Canadian, but here‚Äôs some good advice from the folks over at Electoral Vote Predictor 2004 Read carefully. Your vote could decide this election. Find out today where your polling place is by calling your county clerk or checking www.mypollingplace.com Alternatively, call 1-866-MYVOTE1 to find your polling place. Check the hours the polls are open with your city or county clerk. Print the League of Women Voters’ card in English or Spanish and put it in your wallet or purse.

item.title: News.com article says George W. Bush is heading for a surprise landslide victory
item.description: News.com: George W. Bush is heading for a surprise landslide victory in next week‚Äôs presidential elections, going by online betting patterns. This article is based on¬†what Betfair.com is disclosing on wagers they have received on the election. Their figures show 2.3 million pounds ($4.2 million) have been wagered on Bush, while Kerry has attracted only 680,000 pounds ($1.25 million) in bets. The Betfair.com folks say that Bush is now at 1-5 odds to stay in office, whereas gamblers can still get odds of 2-1 on Kerry to win.
