item.title: How to cancel your Audible.com Account
item.description: I ran into the same problem that Jerermy Zawodny and a few others did as well. There is no way on the Audible.com web site to cancel your subscription. *sigh* To cancel the Audible subscription, I had to: Search and search their site for where to cancel and opt out Send a customer service request to ask how I got an email back saying they need me to call a number Wait on hold (still on hold now) Goodbye Audible, I‚Äôll never be back.

item.title: How I get things done / Kicking some butt on your email inbox ‚Äì Part 2

item.title: How I get things done / Kicking some butt on your email inbox ‚Äì Part 1
item.description: I get a lot of mail and wanted to share how I manage the large volumes of email, tasks and information that I get while working at Microsoft. I use a variety of tools to help me incorporate David Allen‚Äôs getting things done methodolgy¬†(GTD) and they work really well for me. As more and more folks come to me and ask me about information management it was time to create something permanent ‚Äúthat scales‚Äù as we say at Microsoft so I can share the knowledge.

item.title: Powdered Shakes, Working out and getting into the flow of a new job
item.description: What an amazing week! I‚Äôve made it through the first 7 days of the 20/20 program. The past week has been full of big changes for me. I met with my dietician and she gave me a bunch of vitamins and minerals (fish oil caplets, calcium and daily multi vitamins), a log book to record eactly what I eat each day, the calories and the total fat.

item.title: I'm on my way to 20/20 Life
item.description: While on vacation this summer and doing some work around the house, I did not have the energy I used to have. Carrying furniture around and moving things up and down stairs made me sweat like a pig. I‚Äôd lose my breath and got tired needing a break before the job was done. To think I used to race BMX and ride motocross, where did it go? Up until the the last few years I could eat lots of anything and my metabolism would make it go away.

The election will be decided for the most part by the undecided voter, so I am more interested in hearing who the undecided voter thought one the debate tonight.

item.title: Flexwiki goes to Sourceforge.net
item.description: David Writes: This evening FlexWiki took the next step in its life and has been made available at SourceForge.net under the Common Public License. With this step, the developer community will have the latest source (including all the WikiTalk features), better access, better tools, and a better legal environment.  The FlexWiki developer community has kinda stalled out a bit over the past few months as I’ve worked to get FlexWiki to this point.

item.title: Note to self: Don't go hiking on Mount St. Helens This Weekend
item.description: AP ‚Äì Small earthquakes rattled Mount St. Helens at the rate of one or two a minute Monday, and seismologists were working to determine the significance of some of the most intense seismic activity in nearly 20 years. Lots happening at work and at home the last couple of weeks (all good), I‚Äôll post some news talking all about what‚Äôs going on in the next day or so.

item.title: Google is hiring for Copernicus Research Station
item.description: Found this on Slashdot.org tonight. Google is hiring for their Copernicus Research Station. üôÇ To get to the many pages that describe the positions you just¬†go to Google search, type Google Jobs and select I‚Äôm feeling lucky.¬†Cute.¬†

item.title: Photos from Farm Aid
item.description: Josie, Lauri and I went to the Farm Aid Concert in at the White River Ampitheater last night. This was Josie‚Äôs first major concert. This is the 19th Farm Aid Concert. I‚Äôve watched them on television ever since I can remember. think Lauri and I started donating to Farm Aid shortly after we moved to the United States from Canada. My grandfather farmed and I have great memories being out on the farm with him during harvest.

item.title: Farm Aid is in Seattle this weekend
item.description: Just a reminder that FarmAid is in Seattle this weekend. Lauri, Josie and I will be there. I am really excited about this. I‚Äôve always dreamt of going to a Farm Aid event and this weekend its in my own backyard. Willie Nelson, John Mellencamp, Dave Matthews, Neil Young and many other artists will be performing to help support the family farm. Its not about the music though folks though, its about helping preserve a way of life in America, the family farm.

item.title: XM to launch Web Service
item.description: I was bummed when the XM PCR was taken off the market. I wanted to use it to broadcast XM Radio throughout my home over my network. I had no desire to break the law and rip music with the recording software that caused its early demise. I just wanted a way to broadcast tunes throughout my home and control it through my computer. Today XM announced that they will ship XM Radio Online and because I already subscribe to their Satellite service I can join in the phone $3.

item.description: This weekend I am in Sebastopol, California attending O‚Äôreilly‚Äôs Foo Camp. It has been a lot of fun so far and I am very excited to be here. Russell Beatie is producing Foo TV¬†which has some cool videos. I admit its been a long time since I‚Äôve slept in a tent, but I slept really well last night and awoke this morning to kids running around playing with a frisbee, folks wandering around looking for coffee.

item.title: 9/11 Compilation Audio
item.description: I‚Äôm spending the weekend up in Sebastopol, California for a private event. Driving up from San Francisco this afternoon I stumbled across the Glenn Beck radio program. Glenn was talking about how he dreamt for the day that 9/10 would return. You know all of us remember where we were on 9/11, but I am not sure if we all remember where we were on 9/10. Glenn played a very touching audio compilation of radio programs, aircraft tower transmissions and other coverage from the day.

item.title: Welcome to Saskatchewan ‚Äì Email from my mom
item.description: Welcome to Saskatchewan. Thank you for visiting our beautiful province. Here are a few things you ought to know to make your stay more pleasant: That slope-shouldered farm boy you are snickering at did more work before breakfast than you will do all week at the gym. It‚Äôs called a ‚Äúgravel road.‚Äù No matter how slow you drive, you‚Äôre going to get dust on your BMW.

item.title: Broadband Test = Smoking Fast
item.description: I run Comcast as my broadband provider up here in Sammamish and I just completed a speed test over at Broadbandreports.com Your download speed : 2979006 bps, or 2909 kbps. A 363.6 KB/sec transfer rate. Your upload speed : 239374 bps, or 233 kbps. It is too bad (although understandable) that they restrict upload speeds as I‚Äôd probably look at putting my externally hosted sites in my home. I wonder how far we are away from the personal server at home for serving up web pages, weblogs and other content.

item.title: I've pulled my public referrers down
item.description: I‚Äôve removed my referrers from public view. The referrer spam just got out of control and I do not want to give these sites any free advertising or Google juice. This sucks as dasBlog has a very cool feature that would email me whenever someone pointed to something on my weblog, but now its been infiltrated with disgusting websites that I do not care to promote. While Googling for a solution to the problem I found a number of automated tools for spaming weblogs, but no whitelists or solutions.

item.title: Josie you have 5 minutes to get ready for the beach or I am going without you
item.description: Recently while reading Russell Beattie‚Äôs Weblog on the AT&T You Will commercials I found one of my favorites commercial spots.Watch the commercial (Quicktime Required) The part where the little girl asks, ‚ÄúWhen can I become a client?‚Äù just pulls at your heart strings. I think balance is pretty mythical, sometimes you‚Äôll have balance and¬†other times you won‚Äôt. I think you just got to try and not forget the folks that are most important to you even when life gets crazy.

item.description: Reading Dave‚Äôs post about staying in Banff tonight brings back greatchildhood memories as I spent a good part of my early childhood in Kamloops, British Columbia moving to Saskatchewan in the fifth grade. Each summer our family would make the trip back to Saskatchewan for vacation which was at least a two day trip. Banff was the perfect spot to pull over and get out of the car to take a break.

item.title: XM Radio pulls the plug on PCR
item.description: From News.com Since XM discontinued the PCR, units have fetched steep premiums on eBay. The device, which retailed for about $50, is getting bids of more than $350 in recent auctions, with sellers advertising the unit as “discontinued” and “rare.” Looks like I missed the boat on this one. I was just telling Lenn last week how I was going to snag one of the PCR units up. I think he was going to get one too.

item.title: Fable for the Xbox has gone gold
item.description: I am really looking forward to playing Fable for the Xbox.¬†Based on the team‚Äôs webcam, it went gold this past week.The XBox site describes Fable like this: Fable‚Ñ¢ is a ground-breaking role-playing adventure game from Peter Molyneux, in which your every action determines your skills, appearance, and reputation. Create your life story from childhood to death.¬†Grow from an inexperienced adolescent into the most powerful being in the world.¬†Choose the path of righteousness or dedicate your life to evil.

item.title: Dave are you going to Saskatchewan?
item.description: Dave Winer¬†writes:Looks like the next stop will be Winnipeg, then across Saskatchewan, Alberta, into Vancouver and back into the US near Seattle. If you are willing to steer of off the trans-Canada¬†a couple of hours you can stop by my hometown of Estevan, Saskatchewan, Canada. Your timing is perfect for a visit to Saskatchewan as the harvest should be in full swing.¬†Make sure you pull over once or twice to ask the farmers in the field how the crops are doing.

item.title: Tivo like rewind and fast forward come to XM Radio
item.description: From [XM 411][1]: The space at the top right now has three buttons; PAUSE, BACK and FORWARD. These are what control the 30 minute replay feature. The SKYFi2 constantly records the last 30 minutes of whatever you listened to, regardless of your changing the channel. One thing to note is that this 30 minute memory gets wiped out every time the unit is turned off. Pressing the BACK button will take you back one event (song change) at a time.

item.title: Twiggy the Waterskiing Squirrel Part 2
item.description: The boat show was fun and Twiggy was one heck of a skiier.¬†I grabbed a low quality video of the Squirrel too. Not getting enough about Twiggy from this blog and need more?¬†Check out this site.Twiggy SkiingJosie hanging with Twiggy and her trainer¬†Lou Ann Best

item.title: Waterskiing Squirrels
item.description: We‚Äôre off to the Seattle Boat Show Today¬†to look at a few boats and most importantly Josie wants to see Twiggy the Water skiing Squirrel.¬†I‚Äôll try and snap a few pictures of Twiggy today.¬†We‚Äôre looking for a cruiser to use in Lake Washington and also for occasional trips to the San Juans. No plans to buy one today, just looking. The saying goes something like, ‚ÄúThe two happiest days in a boat owners life are The Day they bought it and the day the sold it.

item.description: Looks like Robert has updated his design and it includes a nice hand written banner. Robert you shoud change the banner graphic to be written with your Tablet PC though and maybe include you signature since you love the tablet so much.

item.title: Halo on the big screen
item.description: From MSNBC: Tonight blew our minds,‚Äù theater co-owner Calvin Timothy said afterward. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre definitely going to keep doing this.‚Äù This is so cool, it reminded me of my first year at Microsoft back in late 1996. I had just started on the Active Server Pages 1.0 Developer Support Team in PSS. Our team was newly formed and if I had to guess about 90 per cent us had just moved to Redmond.

item.title: Can someone coach me online with Top Spin?
item.description: I picked up Top Spin last night for my¬†Xbox and boy do I ever suck. Is there anyone out there who can give me a few pointers through Xbox Live? I‚Äôd really appreciate the help. I am not sure what I can offer in exchange, but you will get the pleasure of seeing how bad I am at this game. My gamertag is JeffSand if you‚Äôre up for a few games this weekend of tennis.

item.title: Back from WSU ‚Äì The XM Radio made a 5 hour drive awesome
item.description: We‚Äôre back from taking Brynn off for her freshman year at WSU.¬†She‚Äôs all settled in and ready to experience campus life. The Pullman area reminded me of¬†the farming community where I grew up, Estevan, Saskatchewan. Here‚Äôs a snapshot I took on the road home, just outside of Pullman.There is nothing quite as soothing as a warm summer night on the prairies, the smell of freshly harvested wheat and the open road.

item.title: WSU Day 2 ‚Äì Getting Brynn's computer on the network
item.description: It day two of getting Brynn all setup at Washington State University.¬†I am very impressed with how the University practices safe computing.¬†In order to get Brynn‚Äôs computer onto the university network, the Resident Assistant came in with a disk which had all the latest patches for Windows XP and complimentary anti-virus software. She had a screenshot of the add/remove programs user interface too to make sure that all the required patches were installed to do a quick compare.

item.description: AP: Group Discovers John the Baptist Cave

item.title: Greetings from Lewiston, Idaho
item.description: Greetings from Lewiston, Idaho (about 20 minutes southeast of Pullman, WA).¬†We spent the morning driving to Pullman and getting Brynn settled in at the university residence. As I watched all the kids unload boxes with their parents it was definitely a who‚Äôs who of the electronics business.¬†Televisions, DVDs players, XBoxes and Playstation 2‚Äôs were in abundance. Brynn lucked out and her dorm is wireless which is pretty cool.¬†We got a hotel down in Lewiston and it has free wi-fi throughout.

item.title: Off to Pullman, WA
item.description: We‚Äôre driving to Pullman, WA¬†today. Our oldest daughter has been accepted into Washington State University.¬†Today, we‚Äôll get her checked into her dorm room and spend a day or two in the area.¬†The great thing about being on an un-vacation is that I am not sure when we‚Äôll be back, it might be tomorrow, it could be the next day, who knows? Let‚Äôs see where the wind blows us.

item.title: BlogJet has built in support for audio blogs
item.description: I just noticed that BlogJet (a weblog editor I am playing with) has built in support for audio blogs.¬†I am going to try it with this post and see if I can be cool like Dave and Adam.¬†This assumes that adding audio to your Blog makes you cool üòâ Update: It worked!¬†It captured my voice (time to get a microphone) and automatically streamed it to my Dasblog powered weblog.

item.title: Thanks Jim Blizzzard for the help with BlogJet
item.description: I‚Äôm playing with BlogJet¬†today.¬†So far the biggest benefit is that it makes it very easy for me to include local images with my posts.¬†I just insert the image file with the WYSIWYG editor and browse for the local copy of the image.¬†BlogJet takes it from there and automatically transfers the file to my server and creates the correct path to the image in the HTML for my post.

item.title: New Banner Graphic for this weblog
item.description: Thank you Jamie for the new banner graphic for this weblog.¬†I‚Äôve updated my site and am now displaying it proudly.¬†One of the things I am going to do over vacation is teach myself a bit of CSS so I can clean the look of the site up a bit.¬†My favorite weblog design right now is FOO‚Äôs.

item.title: My Favorite Google Search
item.description: One of my favorite time killers is the Google search ‚Äú[favorite class game ] Flash‚Äù.¬† Tonight‚Äôs favorites choices from these searches were Sonic Flash¬†and Nintendo Flash. üôÇ¬†Gotta love going on a Rampage with Mario

item.title: On Vacation
item.description: I‚Äôm on vacation for the next two weeks. üôÇ üôÇ The cool thing about is that we have nothing planned, no trips to distant lands or the typical tourist traps.¬†Its just two weeks at home getting caught up with my wife and daughters. Today was a fun start as the bunkbeds we ordered for our youngest daughter arrived.¬†I had the pleasure of setting them up while she waited ‚Äúpatiently‚Äú for me to complete the job.

item.title: My Favorite charity event is in Seattle this year ‚Äì Farm Aid
item.description: My favorite charity event is headed to the Pacific Northwest! On September 18th, Willie Nelson, Neil Young, John Mellencamp, and Dave Matthews will be at the White River Ampitheater to host Farm Aid.¬†Farming runs deep in my family for many generations and is something I care deeply about. The American farm needs your help like never before, please try and help.¬†Let‚Äôs keep family farmers on their land. Family farmers are our only guarantee for fresh, local food.

item.title: Our mural girl now has a weblog
item.description: Last fall I decided to do something special for my wife.¬†Lauri has always been completely supportive of my work at Microsoft and I wanted to make her birthday very special.¬†You see our dining room has twenty foot ceilings and is a very nice space, but the walls were plain, we‚Äôd looked over and over for the right piece of art but nothing seemed to fit in.¬†I wanted to get something for her that would make a big impact on the look of this space.

item.title: Build your own XM Radio Home Kit
item.description: I want to listen to my Roady in the house.¬†It is made to be used in my car.¬†There is a home kit for it¬†that I am supposed to get as part of a rebate program. Rebates suck, I hate waiting 4-6 weeks.¬†I want to listen to my Roady in the house now and don‚Äôt want to wait anymore.¬†Today just as I was about to order it from the web I had a Magyver moment.

item.title: Now on DasBlog 1.6.4121.1
item.description: Just moved to DasBlog Version 1.6.4121.1.¬†Thanks Omar¬†for the great instructions on how to upgrade from Version 1.5.¬†I think Omar did a lot of the work behind this latest version and there are some new features and updates in this build all listed out on the Dasblog Wiki.

item.title: An old friend is going to Berkley ‚Äì He wrote the first social network I've ever used
item.description: An old time friend, Jordan Breckenridge is off to Berkley to get his MBA.¬†Jordan and I spent our younger years programming Commodore 64 and Commodore 128 computers and hanging out on Bulletin Board Systems.¬†Our parents took turns giving us rides to and from each others houses.¬†Together we hung out, shared programs and talked about building applications. One of the coolest programs Jordan wrote back in the day (high school) was a modern day equivalent of Orkut.

item.title: Pure Iron or Pure Cuteness?
item.description: Betsy writes:But over the course of the bbq I got to chat with folks about making music for video games, the lack of information around the Halo2 beta (no, I‚Äôm not one of the testers), how to pick a good digital camera (I got to hear Dave Winer‚Äôs views on his Nikon Coolpix, as well as the Canon contingent‚Äôs favorite choices), the old days at Microsoft and Apple, and the joys of small children (this last from Jeff Sandquist, who has a child that will rule the world one day if not through iron will, pure cuteness) As Josie‚Äôs Dad I think it will be a combination of iron will and cuteness üôÇ¬†It reminds me of the conversation Josie and I had in the backyard when she was 3 1/2 and had just gotten her first tricycle.

item.title: I wish I had the Roady 2
item.description: The other day while at Best Buy I noticed that they had the XM Radio Roady 2 in stock.¬†I didn‚Äôt know the Roady 2 was coming out when I bought the Roady 1 last month.¬†I should have known better as rebates were abound and I suppose this was to get the Roady 1‚Äôs out of inventory.¬†I still *love* the content, its totally changed my commute for the better.

item.title: It is in Windows XP Service Pack 2
item.description: Dave writes:There‚Äôs something missing from Windows. An application that hooks into the outbound Internet message flow, and shows me where messages are going. This would allow me to figure out what spyware is running on my system even if the various utilities can‚Äôt get rid of them. Then the next step would be to allow me to block traffic to certain servers. That would disable the spyware. It seems that I should have control of my machine at that level.

item.title: Paint.NET is an amazing project

It maintains some of the best features of the original MS-Paint application and includes new, powerful tools. Such new tools include a history storage for undos and redos, and powerful multi-layering which is often seen only in high-quality, expensive photo-applications.

item.title: BloggerCon ‚Äì Presidential Bloggers hosted by Dan Gilmor
item.description: I am in the Presidential Blogging hosted by Dan Gilmor.¬†There are representatives here from all campaigns (Kerry, Dean, but no one from the Bush weblog).¬†The discussion is on how weblogs are being used by the parties to promote the candidates and engage in the community.Is presidential blogging just another type of press release? Its all about interaction.¬†If you don‚Äôt interact via comments and with the greater Blogosphere you‚Äôve only got a press release.

item.title: BloggerCon ‚Äì Visions from Users Lisa Williams

item.title: Have you thanked a soldier lately?
item.description: Ideas can spread quickly across the blogosphere.¬†Today I‚Äôd like to go out on a limb and float a baloon. This is something that I‚Äôve wrestled a lot about whether or not to post. Have you thanked a soldier lately? I‚Äôm a Canadian and also proud to be in the United States. In fact I am currently working on naturalizing to become a United States citizen. I often travel and sometimes with Lenn.

item.description: It has been a little over seven days since our team launched Channel 9. item.title: Making the most with what you have
item.description: Today I had the great fortune to see¬†an amazing¬†presentation by Mike Schlappi, who tells an incredible personal story of how he overcame a tragic shooting accident to live an amazing life and gain 3 olympic medals. I love these types of talks, makes me realize how lucky I‚Äôve been in my life and how there‚Äôs no excuses to push hard and dream big. A friend of mine, originally from my home province of Saskatchewan does a similar talk that Mike does, his name is Alvin Law.

item.title: More on the Seven Days
item.description: Lots of good feedback from my recent post on how I evaluate software.¬†Marc¬†and Buzz add to the discussion as well.¬†On Marc‚Äôs weblog there is an especially good comment from Hal Rottenberg where he adds some more rules: The Five-Minute Rule: ‚ÄúIf software breaks within the first 5 minutes of install or usage, TOSS IT.‚Äù The One-Day Rule: ‚ÄúUse a new piece of software for a day. When I wake up in the morning, if I am not moved to continue using it, or if I am having difficulty using or configuring it, uninstall it.

item.title: My Guru has a blog ‚Äî Subscribed
item.description: My Guru¬†now has a Weblog, this is great and much more useful and personal than a newsletter.¬†Welcome to the party David.

item.title: If its good enough for seven days I'll buy it
item.description: Tonight Scoble mentioned, my seven day rule for evaluating software and I figured I‚Äôd explain a bit more about my short attention span for new applications.¬†I love to try out new software all the time, in fact its sort of an obsession.¬†I‚Äôm always on the prowl for cool new applications.¬†After seven days of use though if I‚Äôm not totally blowon away or if its not improving my PC life, its straight to add/remove programs I go.

item.title: Join the Road 2 Longhorn XBOX Live Links Group
item.description: Let‚Äôs play a round or two of Golf together‚Ä¶ Years ago when I lived in Canada I played a fair amount of golf.¬†At the company I worked for it was pretty much company policy that your customer meetings were to be done on the greens.¬†This did little to improve my game (I‚Äôm a total hack), but I did make many friends and the customers loved it.¬†Nothing beats four hours of fun with friends accompanied with great scenery and a few cold drinks.

item.title: Moving from Radio to DasBlog
item.description: With no disrespect intended for to Radio Userland I made the move to DasBlog this weekend from my old site.  I also secured a domain name giving this place a bit more permanance.   For those of you considering making such a move I’ve included some tips and utilities to help you on your way that will allow you to get DasBlog up and runng and make it so you can take your Radio content and comments aloing with you.

item.title: Is Dave headed in this direction?
item.description: I think I know where Dave is headed with his new categorization system, or at least this is where¬†I hope he is headed. üôÇ What if all Weblog entries had religous use of categories like Dave‚Äôs has been applying to his posts since inception?¬†First off its not realistic to think everyone will change their ways and become the masters of categories.¬†Also what I think might be a story about home improvement to another person could be about modern art.

item.title: A Picaso in the making?
item.description: Well that is probably taking things a bit far, but boy are we excited with the progress this weekend on the mural.¬†On Friday the scaffolding arrived and I helped Jodie put it up.¬†Jodie has been telling us all week once the scaffolding goes up we‚Äôll see things really come together.¬†Wow, what an understatement!¬†Look at all the work completed in the last 48 hours.Friday evening shortly after the scaffolding was erected.

item.title: Pumpkin Pancakes aka tomorrow's non-Atkins breakfast
item.description: 2 1/3 cups Bisquick baking mix 2 tablespoons dark brown sugar, firmly packed <o:p></o:p> 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon <o:p></o:p> 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg <o:p></o:p> 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger <o:p></o:p> 1 1/4 cups milk <o:p></o:p> 2 eggs, lightly beaten <o:p></o:p> 1/3 cup mashed pumpkin <o:p></o:p> 1/4 cup vegetable oil <o:p></o:p> Beat all ingredients with whisk or hand beater until well blended. Pour batter by scant 1/4 cupfuls onto hot, lightly greased griddle or skillet.

item.title: Mural Update
item.description: Slowly, but surely the mural is taking shape.¬†Jodi is really taking her time on this, I believe this is her first major project so she‚Äôs trying to make a showcase out of it.¬†We‚Äôre thrilled to have her talent involved in this. Tomorrow the scaffolding arrives and Jodi says she‚Äôs going to be¬†spending a lot of time here once it arrives.¬†We‚Äôll see a lot more progress then.¬†Of course as the old cliche goes a picture is worth a thousand words, so I‚Äôve uploaded some photos highlighting the progress to date.

item.title: Thanks Giving with the Parents
item.description: My parents were in town this week and in honour of their arrival we celebrated an early and also a belated Thanksgiving Dinner.  I missed Canadian Thanksgiving Dinner up at my parents house and will be away for the upcoming American one.  One of the advantages of being a Canadian married to an American is that we celebrate both the American and Canadian dates.   The week has been great!   I’ve been getting caught up on sleep and of course my gaming.

item.title: It sure is good to be back home again
item.description: PDC¬†is over and its great to be back home.¬†Man, it feels just like yesterday that we were down in LA checking out the venue, visiting Universal and doing hotel¬†visits.¬†In addition to being one of those guys helping with some of the logistics for the event I was part of a team of people amping community around the PDC.¬†This included the PDC 2003 Community Environment (yes, we know lousy name).

item.title: Mural Update
item.description: Came home tonight around 9:00 PM and Jodie had been here painting.  She is very meticulous, just look at the details as she paints in the stonework.   I removed the white handrail shown in my [previous entry][1] from the wall to the right of the stairs as well.  No sense in having Jodie’s amazing work blocked by an unsightly handrail.   We plan to replace it with a wrought iron piece on the opposite wall.

item.title: I'm Blogging This T-Shirts
item.description: Glad to see you like the t-shirt and yes you are most defiinitely Welcome.¬†One thing I should mention is that I am not the only person behind these t-shirts.¬†These are compliments of the entire Longhorn Evangelism team.¬†I was thinking the other day what would be very cool is to see photos of the t-shirts at unique landmarks as you all make your way to the PDC.We’ll definitely need to try and do a group photo, maybe Wednesday night at Universal Studios?

item.title: McCurry Anyone
item.description: McCurry Anyone? This is cool.¬†Why can‚Äôt they bring this to the United States?¬†You know I hate to admit it, but I‚Äôve been eating more than my fair share of fast food lately and I am so tired of it.¬†I want Mc Curry!¬†Check out the menu at McDonald‚Äôs of India, it looks great for fast food.¬†Has anyone tried this?

item.title: The Mural Project ‚Äì A gift for my wife
item.description: I‚Äôve done very little writing on my weblog, except for some brief PDC promotional fodder.¬†I‚Äôve had very lttle time as I‚Äôve been one of the guys driving logistics around the PDC, specifically around community.¬†With a week to the event, we‚Äôre in crunch mode.¬†During these times one thing that never ceases to amaze me is my wife‚Äôs attitude.¬†There‚Äôs never a complaint about my crazy hours and she makes sure that I can focus by just making sure that things get done at home.

item.title: Roxio to acquire PressPlay
item.description: I have for the past few months been enjoying my subscription to PressPlay.¬†I take great interest in today‚Äôs news that Roxio has acquired PressPlay.¬†It will be fun watching Roxio relaunch the¬†Napster service. My family is hooked on PressPlay.¬†I have a PC configured with PressPlay connected to our Bose home theater.¬†We use Windows XP‚Äôs Remote Desktop feature to control the PressPlay PC from a laptop via my home 802.

item.title: Blooming in Seattle
item.description: I love how my plants are turning out this year.¬†One of the nice things about Seattle‚Äôs winter of rain and gloom is that you appreciate the summer weather.¬†I need to work on my plant selection though, when I picked the plants for my landscaping I didn‚Äôt get enough variety.¬†Once my Rhododenreons¬†loose their flowers my backyard loses some of its shine.So can someone recommend plantings that will get me blooms from now until September?

item.title: Hello World ‚Äî Take 3
item.description: After many failed attempts at writing a web log¬†and finally being encouraged by two co-workers to pick up the proverbial pen I‚Äôm at it once again.¬†I‚Äôve played with a number of the web-logging clients this last year.¬†I‚Äôve used Blogger.com¬†for my family photo gallery, BlogX¬†for an Internal weblog, Erablog to test the new Windows Media Plug-in and now Radio¬†for this weblog.¬†Radio has it quirks (doesn‚Äôt all software :-)), but I decided to shell out $39.
